strIntroduction: This bus will take you to both Kanagawa Prefecture and Shizuoka Prefecture to visit Odawara Castle, Lake Ashi and Mt. Fuji 5th Station, where you can enjoy the splendid view of the lake and the mountain! This bus tour departs from Shinjuku and will take you to Odawara Castle, where you can explore the history and the ancient of Odawara. After visiting the Odawara Castle, enjoy having your lunch at Minoya Kichibei in Odawara, where you can enjoy an all-you-can-eat crab dishes. After lunch, enjoy cruising on Lake Ashi from Motohakone Port with Hakone Pirate Ship, while enjoying the precious scenery of Mt. Fuji from on top of the boat! After cruising on Lake Ashi, you will visit the Mt. Fuji 5th station, which is a great spot for sightseeing. Explore the restaurants to enjoy the local food and the souvenir shops to buy some local crafts! The itinerary of the tour is as follows: Bus departs from Hotel Gracery Shinjuku - 8:30 Meet up at Shinjuku Washington Hotel - Depart to Odawara Castle by bus - Explore the Odawara Castle (40 minutes) - Have all-you-can-eat crab lunch at Odawara – Minoya Kichibei (50 minutes) - Depart to Motohakone Port by bus - Cruise on Lake Ashi with Hakone Pirate Ship (30 minutes) - Arrive at Togenkyo Port - Depart to Mt. Fuji 5th Station by bus - Stroll around Mt. Fuji 5th Station (40 minutes) - Depart to Shinjuku by bus - 18:30 – 19:00 Tour ends You can enjoy free Wi-Fi and electrical socket inside the bus, and get some prizes by participating in the lottery event while traveling on the bus. You can also get a fold-away bag for free by making a reservation with our service (limited offer until the end of September)! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: All-you-can-eat Crab Lunch & Mt. Fuji 5th Station Bus Tour

strIntroduction: Explore the best sights in Miyazaki prefecture with this 6 hour long private car tour that departs Hososhima Port and takes you to both breathtaking natural and man-made sightseeing spots. You will visit the legendary Amanoiwato Shrine, dedicated to the Sun Goddess Amaterasu, who is said to have hid inside a cave from her brother who liked to play pranks on her. This is a myth that the ancient Japanese used to explain the solar eclipse. The shrine is located opposite a cave near the Iwato river and holds a significant place in Japanese mythology. If you follow the path leading out of Amanoiwato Shrine, you will start to see piles of rocks arranged as a symbol of the pilgrimage that other people have undertaken to this sacred place, and eventually you will be able to reach Amano Yasukawara Cave, where you can partake in a purification ritual held by the shrine priest who will be happy to answer your questions and explain the sacred nature of the place. Another highlight of this tour is Takachiho Gorge, a natural wonder hidden in the Kyushu mountains. It is a V-shaped gorge with steep cliffs rising up from the Gokase river, featuring the breathtaking Manai Falls, a 17-meter high waterfall that creates a majestic atmosphere due to the mist produced by the fall of water into the river. There is also a 600 meter long walking trail where you can admire the local vegetation that, as in the rest of Japan, varies according to the seasons. The 1,200 year-old Takachiho Shrine is nearby, it is one of the most sacred temples in Japan because it is said it was here that the Goddess-sun Amaterasu descended. The tour will also take you to Kunimigaoka Observatory, featuring breathtaking views of the Kyushu mountains, and notable for the thick layer of fog that usually covers the mountaintops giving it a surreal atmosphere. It is ideal for a morning stroll to quiet the mind and relax in a natural environment. The tour ends back in Hosohima Port. However, because it's a private tour, you'll have the flexibility to visit the sights at your own pace and according to your interests. Don't miss the chance to explore the best of Miyazaki prefecture in the comfort of your own private tour.
strTitle: Shore Excursion to Takachiho in Miyazaki with a private car

strIntroduction: Ugetsu Chaya is a traditional tea house with tatami mats and large wooden tables, located inside an insuperable location: the World Heritage Daigoji Temple in eastern Kyoto. As if that wasn't enough, the temple is surrounded by Japanese maple trees and other vegetation that turn golden and crimson with the arrival of autumn, giving the whole place a beautiful and almost surreal appearance. Imagine having this quintessential Kyoto landscape as backdrop to a delicious Japanese course meal, and on top of that, being able to admire the autumn leaves with special illumination designed to highlight the beautiful colors. Dining at Ugetsu Chaya promises to be more than a night out, it allows you to enjoy Kyoto up close in an authentic environment without the crowds you often find at touristic spots. Likewise, you will be able to experience Kyoto through its traditional course meal cuisine featuring local and seasonal ingredients from the area prepared to perfection and served to you in a beautiful presentation. With your dinner reservation, you will also have access to the night-time visit of the area, which will allow you to enjoy the landscape at your pace. Don't miss the chance to experience Kyoto's authentic cuisine and autumn landscapes.
strTitle: Dine in a traditional tea house among Kyoto's autumn leaves

strIntroduction: This bus will take you to Yamanashi Prefecture to visit Lake Kawaguchi, Mt. Fuji 5th Station, and Misaka Farm where you can do an all-you-can-eat grape picking! Mt. Fuji 5th station is a great place for sightseeing, as it has many souvenir shops and restaurants that you can stroll around. You can also enjoy the splendid view of Mt. Fuji from this station, as it is close enough to the summit of Mt. Fuji! After visiting the Mt. Fuji 5th station, you will be visiting Miharashi-tei for lunch, a local restaurant at Lake Kawaguchi. At this restaurant, you can enjoy the grilled pork and grilled smelt (vegetarian / non-pork meal is available upon request, please inform us when booking). After lunch, you will be visiting the Kawaguchi-kohan station, where you will have a ride on the ropeway. Enjoy the astonishing view of the Lake Kawaguchi & Mt. Fuji from the ropeway! After riding on the ropeway, you will visit Fujimidai station to enjoy the scenery from the observatory before visiting Misaka farm for its famous all-you-can-eat grape picking! After visiting the Misaka-farm, you will visit Chateau Katsunuma where you can taste and purchase Yamanashi's local wine. The itinerary of the tour is as follows: Bus departs from - 7:30 Hotel Gracery Shinjuku - 7:50 Shinjuku Washington Hotel - Depart to Mt. Fuji 5th station (90 minutes) - Stroll around Mt. Fuji 5th station (50 minutes) - Have lunch at Miharashi-tei, Lake Kawaguchi (50 minutes) - Walk to Kawaguchi-kohan station - Have a ride on the ropeway (8 minutes) - Enjoy panoramic view from the observatory at Fujimidai station (40 minutes, including a returning ropeway journey to Kawaguchi-kohan station) - Depart for Misaka Farm by bus - All-you-can-eat grape picking (30 minutes) - Wine tasting and shopping at Chateau Katsunuma (30 minutes) - Return to Shinjuku by bus (90 minutes) - 18:20 Tour ends This bus tour is very famous, so make a reservation in advance with our service and get a free folding shopping bag! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Bus Tour To Mt. Fuji 5th Station Ropeway & Grape Picking!

strIntroduction: This is a sightseeing tour in Sakura city, Chiba prefecture, near Narita Airport, on a scooter with a Japanese guide. Below is the schedule of this tour: 1. We will Pick you up at Keisei-Sakura Station, Keisei-Usui Station or JR Sakura Station at 9:00 am. 2. You will receive the scooter at my shop after you sign the contract. 3. Gloves and helmet rental requires additional fee. (500 JPY/day) 4. The tour starts around 10:00 am. 5. We will tour around the Sakura city's attractions: rice paddies, windmill, Lake Inbanuma, National Museum of Japanese History, Sake brewery and more. 6. Along the way we will eat lunch at a ramen restaurant. 7. Before 16:00 pm, we will refuel with gasoline at a gasoline station, and return to my shop. 8. We will send you off to the station. You must have a Japanese driver's license or an International Driving Permit for this tour.
strTitle: Ride a Scooter in Sakura city, near Narita Airport

strIntroduction: This is a one day tour around Enoshima Island's highlights! Lunch at Seafood restaurant: Enoshima has specific seafood meals. You can enjoy them for lunch. Also on the Benten street, you can get snacks and souvenirs. Enoshima Shrine: Everything in the shrine has a special meaning. Our guide will tell you the story of legend and history about Enoshima. Enoshima Sea Candle tower (Observatory): The observatory is not so high, but the view is sweeping. Enoshima is surrounded by the ocean, so nothing obstructs your view. Enoshima Ryugu (Dragon): The dragon has close relations with the origin of Enoshima. What does the dragon mean? Why do people worship the dragon? Enoshima Iwaya Caves: They are not just caves. There are many attractions and you will be given a small Japanese lantern to go into the dark caves. If you go down the caves, you will surely find something. Can you guess what you will see?
strTitle: Find many attractions in Enoshima: Ocean, History, Seafood!

strIntroduction: Drive for about two and half hours through beautiful Japanese countryside, mountains and along winding rivers to Kumano Hongu Shrine. Walk up the stone steps to Kumano Hongu Shrine and also visit the largest Tori Gate in the World.. Make a short stop at Kumano Hayatama Shrine and find lunch in a local restaurant or grab a lunch box and find a nice spot outside to eat. Drive for about one hour to Kumano Nachi Shrine and hike up to the waterfall and visit the beautiful red pagoda. Nachi is the highest waterfall in Japan and with the red pagoda in the foreground makes for an amazing photo opportunity. After an awesome journey through the mountains of Nara and Wakayama, spend a night on Oshima Island in a Japanese Inn or stay in budget hotel in Kushimoto city. Sushi dinner or Japanse Inn dinner included. Next day wake up early and watch the sunrise if possible. Eat breakfast and drive along the coastal highway with amazing views, then up through the mountain roads to Koyasan. Grab something to eat and then wander through the massive cedars and ancient graveyard of Okunoin, which is the largest cemetery in Japan. Then walk along the path to Kongobunji Temple stopping in the central shop area for souvenirs.
strTitle: Explore the famous shrines of Kumano Kodo in a private tour

strIntroduction: Location photo tour can be the way you get to know the deep perspective on Tokyo that only a few people know. This service is offered with an interpreter and a photographer who knows around the area well. He/she will take photos during your adventure. Akihabara Akihabara is known as a Mecca of Anime, Manga and Japanese-Pop culture. We will show you the other avant-garde perspective of Akihabara you haven't seen yet. We'll go around Akihabara and its streets that have lots of unique shops. You can get original and handmade crafts assembled by young creators and designers. Ryogoku Roygoku is famous for Sumo. Also there are a lot of interesting spots. You can eat "Chanko" which is a hot-pot meal originally for Suko wrestlers. Ryogoku is just by Sumida river, and you can have a relaxing time with comfortable wind and an atmosphere of the old downtown. We will explore the Edo Tokyo Musum, Ryogoku-Kokugikan and Yasuda Japanese garden. You will get to know what beautiful Old Japan was. Kuramae Kurama is in between Asakusa and Ueno area. Nowadays it is becoming a hot spot where you can enjoy modern and high-designed cafe, handcraft workshop. And you can get a handmade refined craft-work. The first place we'll go is Kamokiri, this is the shop where you can make your original notebook. And there are lots unique and exclusive stationary goods that you can only see here. Cross the Sumida river and get some yummy nibbles. Tokyo Sky Tree Tokyo Sky Tree is known as the most famous spot for tourists. The tall is 634 meter high and it's the second tallest building in the world. At the viewing deck (450 meter high), the view of Tokyo from the bird's eye will make you feel as if you were the Emperor of Tokyo.
strTitle: Deep Tokyo Photo excursion with a professional Photographer

strIntroduction: Niseko is one of the best powder snow destination in the world. The area offers a tons of slopes with fresh powder snow. As a true local, I will guide you to best slopes of the day. I will guide you around backcountry areas of Niseko. The tour starts with a conversation with the guest to introduce myself as a ski guide. It is very important to guide you safely to know about each other so that we can ski and snowboard comfortably. My backcountry tour includes photo service, tips for good riding, explanation of Niseko and Japan. As a true local, I can guide you around good places to eat and relax after ski and snowboard. I can guide you anywhere you want to ride around Niseko. If you are not an advanced skier or snowboarder, I can take you to easier mountain slopes with spectacular views.
strTitle: Enjoy a Niseko Backcountry ski & snowboard tour

strIntroduction: Niseko is the most scenic town in Hokkaido. There are some opportunities for taking amazing photos of the countryside landscape. In this private DOWNHILL cycling tour you will visit some of the best spots and take amazing photos. Even if you have been there before, you will experience something different when riding a bike. Our private dowhnill cycling tours are a hybrid of the self-guided, and are also considered “semi-guided.” These tours are the same as self-guided with one primary exception: the addition of a support van rather than a ride-along guide. Here is the tour we have for our beginner or intermediate cyclists: -Private Downhill Cycling Tour in Niseko- Details: The easiest way to discover Niseko. Level: Relaxed and Moderate Total distance: about 14 km Duration: about 3 hours *Minimum amount is 2 people, Maximum 5 people. *The price includes; Rental bike, English speaking support, helmet, a bottle of mineral water. *This tour is available every day between Jun 5 and Oct 25th. You can decide the starting time between 9 am and until 3 pm. Note that the price includes about 3-hour tour. If you want to extend the tour, you need to pay additionally.
strTitle: Enjoy Niseko Downhill Cycling Tour in Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Photo Shooting (It takes 2.5-3 hours to complete) Please arrive at the studio 10 minutes before your appointment. Even if you arrive too early, depending on the situation of the previous customers, we might be unable to support you. Select the “Kimono” of your choice. Then, we will dress up, do hair-set, and make-up for your children. Once your children are ready, we will start shooting, while suggesting studios and poses to fit the particular “Kimono.” Shooting patterns are: 1. Mainly the child (90%), 2. Photos with brothers and sisters (5%), and 3. Family photos (5%). ※ Concerning the family photo, according to the atmosphere of our studio, it is recommended to wear casual (a jacket and pants) rather than formal (suits), natural color or light colors than black line, and western style clothes than Kimono. ※ As the studio is exclusive for children, each room may be small by its size and capacity. So please understand in advance, that the family photo will not be the ones like traditional style, which are in a big room. ※ Concerning shooting with your friends, relatives, and your family, up to two families of the child can be in the shooting. In addition, the shooting of the main children will be up to two children. ※Although we welcome you to visit us in a large number of people, the number of pictures of one child will be decreased upon increasing the number of children and families. When you have finished shooting, we will edit the taken photo data (up to 60 minutes). Meanwhile, we offer you drinks, so please relax in a private rooms exclusively for your family. ※ In this room, children are welcome to dine, but the adults should refrain from dining. Free Wi-Fi and smartphone charger are also available. 150 types of Japanese children's animation are also available on a TV. Exhibition of the latest Japanese electronic magazines and photo books are also available. Smoking is available at the balcony on the second floor. In addition, it is also possible to see sightseeing spots around the studio during this time. You can rent two bicycles, a Wi-Fi pocket, and a tablet for free. So you can go around the sights without hesitation. ※ Please come back to the studio within 60 minutes of editing. After we have finished editing, you can watch a slide show of the taken photos on a wall-mounted TV. Then we will give you the shooting photo data (30 to 50 sheets), which you watched in the slide show in a CDR. In addition, at this time, we will send a web album to your registered e-mail address that was registered at the time of reservation. From the web album, you can look at and download all the shots from the day in your smart phone and PC. ※ At our studio, we will shoot about 150 photos per group. Yet, we do not ask you to select 30 to 50 photos of your favorite at a monitor. Our cameraman will check all the 150 photos, will eliminate the photos with blur, closed eyes, the same composition, the same look, and so on, will select 30 to 50 photos, will retouch and trim, and then hand in the photos to a customer. ※ Shooting of children is LIVE! There is a range of 30 to 50 photos. This is because there are influences such as children's condition (they don't like wearing Kimono, they never stop even for a second, and so on), shooting many people in a group, and so on, which takes time for preparing not for shooting itself.
strTitle: Have photos of your kids in kimono taken in a pro studio!

strIntroduction: This is a unique activity containing the following experiences: 1. SAMURAI DANCE SHOW Enjoy a lively and dramatic samurai dance performance by a Samurai dancer, Ryuou Arai, who is the current third head master of his traditional Japanese arts school. Explanation of the samurai dance will be provided as well. Audience would be able to immense themselves in the unique atmosphere of traditional Japanese entertainment. So come on down to witness the spectacular samurai dance performance which utilizes Japanese sword (katana) and Kimono which are usually used and worn by the samurais in ancient times right now! ２. SAMURAI COSTUME DRESS UP You will be able to wear a kimono. Firstly you will choose variety of some Kimono. Then learn how to tie the obi (the string that supports your kimono along your waist) and wear a kimono with the aid of our staffs. After you have put on your kimono, you can take a commemorative photo while wielding either a fan or a Japanese sword (katana). ３. SAMURAI DANCE EXPERIENCE When you have finished dressing up, learn a simple choreography from our samurai dancer. You will learn how to draw and cut the a Japanese sword. Continue to learn some advanced sword stance and walking style of the olden days of Japan. Complete your session with some challenging Samurai dance. You will experience the dance that the samurais would do before they fight a battle. You will feel the samurai spirit through experiencing the dance. After the experience you will get a diploma certifying the completion of your activity. About the instructor: Debut at: 3 years old School: Kinou Ryuu（錦凰流） Position: third head master License: Samurai Dance Master Accomplishments: 2008 Performed in Dalian, China 2014 Lectured at Oxford University 2015 Lectured at the University of Sydney This activity is held in Kichijoji, Tokyo.
strTitle: Dress up like a samurai and enjoy a samurai dance in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: You can wear a costume actually used in Kabuki, put on Kabuki makeup, and take a photo in the old playhouse "Aioi-za" in Mizunami, Gifu prefecture. Aioiza is a playhouse equipped with a full-scale theater structure, including Hanamichi (passage through the audience), Suppon (a trapdoor on the Hanamichi from which an actor appears on stage), a revolving stage, and more. It is also a Jikabuki Museum housing more than 4,500 items, including costumes, wings, and stage properties of Jikabuki passed down from the end of the Edo period. Kabuki is a form of theatrical art unique to Japan. When the art of Kabuki started in the Edo period, its modern and eccentric costumes and hairdos and the gorgeous, picture-like stage sets fascinated many people. People in rural parts of the nation, who were enthusiastic fans of Kabuki , learned the art of Kabuki from traveling acting troupes, and eventually started organizing and playing Kabuki performance themselves in their hometowns. Such amateur forms of Kabuki played in rural parts of Japan are called "Jikabuki", which still continues today in some regions. Kabuki costume experience in Gifu: Dates: 10/２（Sun）・10/８（Sat）・10/16（Sun）・10/29（Sat）・11/6（Sun）・11/12（Sat） From 13:30 or 15:30 Capacity: Up to 3 persons at a time Required time: Approximately 120 minutes *The time varies by the number of persons. What to bring: Face towel You will receive a present, an Oshiguma (a printing of Kabuki actors’ face makeup on cloth).
strTitle: Experience dressing up as a kabuki actor in Gifu

strIntroduction: Izakaya is a Japanese pub that is very popular among all ages. If you have 2 hours free in the evening, let’s go to Izakaya and enjoy a great time together. You must go to Izakaya at least once while you are in Japan! It is highly recommended to be there on the first day of tour trip to Japan in order to obtain various information on Japan and Japanese people, while talking to your host in a relaxing and refreshing atmosphere. At the same time, you can observe Japanese people and culture at the Izakaya. By starting your trip in the Izakaya, you will enjoy the rest of your stay more in Japan. After you finished your activity and sightseeing for the day, just go to the Izakaya and enjoy the most popular Japanese foods and drinks. You can feel real Japan there. Below is the sample schedule of this activity: 18:00 Meet at your hotel Go to Izakaya nearby your hotel Enjoy your foods & drinks 20:00 Go back to your hotel
strTitle: Enjoy a joyful Izakaya night in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Get ready to dance salsa all night and have an exciting time. I will take you to at least 3 different clubs and introduce you to all the best dancers and other Tokyo dancer friends. I will pick you up at your hotel, AirBnB or central location and we will take the train, taxi or walk to the dance establishment. We will dance there and get a drink (non-alcohol is OK) and go to two other places. I will accompany/partner you while allowing you to roam around and enjoy yourself. If you want to dance all dances that is fine with me too. I will dance give you lessons and pointers on how to improve your salsa/bachata/merengue style. You may just want a salsa wingman/guide and not a dance partner -- that's OK too. I will show you the most exciting spots and best dancers. Fees pay for my transportation and admission to all events. You pay nothing extra. In general I go around with you until you find a place you like as long as I am under the payment amount. Your additional costs would be your own admission fees. Most clubs are 1500 JPY (US 15), some events are 2000-5000 JPY (US 50). I will chat online with you and send you an itinerary (w/descriptions, but no club names). If you have any questions let me know then. Yes, I also teach salsa/bachata/merengue dance. If you are a beginner and want to learn on this trip I will instruct you and give you all my pointers. I am known to be a very good and fun teacher. I employ easy to learn methods. Shall we dance! SALSA?
strTitle: Go Partying with a Salsa Nights Guide and Male Escort

strIntroduction: In this unique experience you will learn the techniques of pulling and using a sword from a professional sword fight scene choreographer and will then become the main character in your own samurai fighting scene movie! You will have the chance to "slash" your opponent and have this experience on video! The movie will be sent to you after the experience and will remain an amazing memory from your trip to Japan! Your teacher and opponent will be Mr Kenji Sato, a well-known fight scene choreographer and action movie stunt man in Japan. He will pay special attention to teaching you the moves of the samurai, pulling out the sword and using it, as well as the action scenes of fighting with swords. Mr Sato has previously worked on "The Last Samurai", "Biohazard", "47 Ronin", "Rurouni Kenshin" and more! This experience is located in Chiba city. The activity takes a total of 3.5 hours (including the changing of clothes) and is available on the following days: October 8, 9 November 12, 13 December 10, 11 January 14, 15 February 11, 12 March 11, 12 You can choose between the following times: 8:30 am to 12:00 pm 12:30 pm to 16:00 pm Please wear clothes that are easy to move in (for example: shorts, T-shirt). Please book this activity at least one week advance. Last-minute bookings will not be accepted. Movie: http://voyag.in/samurai_chiba_01 http://voyag.in/samurai_chiba_02 http://voyag.in/samurai_chiba_03
strTitle: Become a swordsman in a samurai movie shooting in Chiba!

strIntroduction: Join this tour to experience ice drifting and get on "Monbetsu Garinko II", one of Japan’s most famous ice breaker! The ice breaker accommodates 195 persons and depart from Monbetsu providing ice-viewing excursions for the travelers. The ice breaker breaks the ice and navigates it in the frozen Okhotsk Sea. The ice drifting season is from January to March, with its peak in February. Enjoy the scenery while drifting on the ice, and sometimes you will have the chance to see the animals come out from the sea such as sea eagles and spotted seals. The average temperature in February is -10℃ (14℉), so we recommend you to wear thick clothes to protect yourself from the cold. This tour will take you to Kamikawa and Monbetsu to enjoy the lunch box of "Kitano – mikaku", which consists assorted local seafood. You will also visit the Dezuka Suisan, a seafood products shop that is famous for its Kamaboko & Kani-mayo ball, and Mikawa Seika to enjoy the famous local sweets "Kita-dora". The itinerary of this tour will be as follows: - Sapporo Station North Exit 6:50 - Kamikawa (short rest) - Monbetsu, Dezuka Suisan (seafood products shop, try the "Kani-mayo ball" and seafood cake) - Monbetsu Port (Ice Drifting with Ice Breaker "Garinko II", 60 min) - Monbetsu Port - Monbetsu Seafood Product Shop - Kamikawa (short rest) - Sapporo Station North Exit 20:00 The tour departs from Sapporo with the following schedules: - January 26, 29 2017 - February 1, 5, 8, 15, 18, 23, 25, 26 2017 - March 3,7 2017 The travel bus on January 29, February 2, 18, 23, and March 3 2017 is equipped with a lavatory. Enjoy your winter this year with this wonderful ice drifting tour by making a reservation with our service! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Monbetsu Garinko II Ice Drifting Tour From Sapporo!

strIntroduction: Visit Kyoto this Autumn to enjoy its wonderful fall foliage, which is more beautiful than the cherry blossoms in Spring! The fall foliage last for two months, and the leaves start changing in Kyoto sometimes in October. The peak of the fall foliage is in mid-November, and you can still see colors on the trees until mid-December. This tour departs from Umeda and Namba, and will take you to 6 different tourists spots by bus, which are perfect for fall foliage. The spots you will be visiting are as follows: - Arashiyama Arashiyama is the second most important sightseeing area in Kyoto, where many temples and shrines are located in this area. It is famous for the Arashiyama Bamboo Grove. - Tenryuji Temple This temple is the headline attraction of Arashiyama, and it accommodates an incredible Zen temple, which garden is one of the finest gardens in Kyoto that has a wonderful mountain views. During the fall foliage, the mountains and the trees will turn red. - Komyoji Temple This temple is a superb temple, that is rarely visited by the tourist. It has a beautiful Japanese garden that will turn red in Fall. - Tofukuji Temple This temple that is carpeted with maple trees, and spanned by three different bridges, will turn red in November, and the view from the Hojo Garden is wonderful during Autumn. - Nanzenji Temple The maple trees near the San-mon gate will look very beautiful on top of the moss during Autumn. - Tetsugaku No Michi (The Path of Philosophy) This path is one of the most attractive sightseeing spots in Kyoto. During the Spring, this path is full with the blooming cherry blossom trees, and during the Autumn, this path is full with the red maple trees. The schedule of the tour will be as follows: - Umeda 7:30 - Namba 7:45 - Arashiyama - Walk around Tenryuji Temple (90 min, including Arashiyama) - Stroll around Komyoji Temple (40 min) - Stroll around Tofukuji Temple (60 min) - Stroll & walk around Nanzenji Temple & Tetsugaku No Michi (90 min) - Umeda or Namba (18:30 - 19:30) Lunch box is included in this tour. Reservation is difficult to make, so don't forget to book this tour in advance! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Visit Kyoto This Autumn To Enjoy The Fall Foliage!

strIntroduction: Visit Gifu and explore Hidatakayama & Shirakawago from Nagoya this fall to enjoy the astonishing view of the Autumn Leaves (Koyo) with your friends or family! This tour departs from Nagoya Station, and will take you to Gifu Prefecture to explore the Takayama and Shirakawago area by bus. After arriving at Takayama, you will have the Kei-chan Gozen set meal, which is a special menu available only in Gifu. The set meal includes fried chicken marinated with miso and soy sauce, served together with cabbage, onions, and other seasonal vegetables. Visit Hida Takayama, which is usually called Takayama, is an area located in northern Gifu prefecture, which is famous for its Sanno-machi Historic District and the Takayama Festival. Takayama, which is popularly called as "Little Kyoto" accommodates many historical places. Enjoy exploring Takayaka Jinya, Hida Folk Museum, and Hida no Sato and learn the traditional culture of Takayama. Explore Shirakawago, a village located at the food of Mt. Hakusan in Gifu prefecture, which is registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1995. Explore the "Gassho-zukuri Farmhouse Village" to enjoy its beautiful scenery. The village is made up of 27 thatched roof houses, which have been relocated from several areas in Shirakawago. The village preserves the classic atmosphere of the area with a temple, a coalhouse, and a horse paddock. Enjoy watching the live performances of traditional industrial arts like dyeing and weaving, and don’t forget to stop by the souvenir shop to buy Shirokawago’s famous soba. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Meet at Nagoya Station ESCA underground shopping mall (West Exit) at 8:20 (8:00 on October 8 &9) Arrive and have lunch at Takayama (50 minutes) Walk around Takayama to enjoy the scenery (90 minutes) Arrive at Shirakawago and walk around (70 minutes) Arrive at Nagoya Station at 19:30 This tour departs on the following dates: - September 10, 11, 17, 18, 19, 22, 24 - October 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10 This tour is very popular among the locals and foreigners, so don't forget to make reservation in advance with our service! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Visit Takayama & Shirakawago From Nagoya by Bus This Autumn!

strIntroduction: Explore Tenjinbashisuji, the longest shopping street in Japan, which is filled with local atmosphere. 10:00 Pick up at JR Temma Station. 10:05 Purara Temma, a local market which has 400 years history. You will see how lively people work and some seasonal fresh food there. 10:30 Have a green tea at a tea shop. You'll learn about Japanese tea culture there. 10:50 Walk along Tenjinbashisuji shopping street and the guide will explain about the street and the culture of shops we pass by, such as kimono, pachinko, Japanese sweets etc. Taste some Japanese flavors such as soy milk at a hand-made tofu shop, croquettes at one of the most popular shop in the area, miso and umeboshi (pickled plum) at an old miso and plum shop on the way to Osaka Tenmangu Shrine. 11:20 Visit Osaka Tenmangu Shrine, which is one of the biggest and historical shrines in Osaka. You'll learn how Japanese people worship at a Shinto shrine. 11:50 Tour Ends at Subway Minami-Morimachi Station / JR Osaka-Tenmangu Station.
strTitle: Go on a Tenjinbashisuji Deep Osaka Walking Tour

strIntroduction: Have you ever used a “fude” brush pen? Let’s write your name in “Kanji” or “Hiragana” or “Katakana” in Omotesando, Tokyo. In this Japanese Calligraphy "Shodo" class, a Japanese Shodo artist will translate your name into Kanji or Hiragana or Katakana. You can practice basic brush techniques & write your name. Finally, you will write on “Washi” paper or "Uchiwa" fan, and you can keep it as a souvenir from your trip! You don't need to bring anything to take part in this class. All tools will be provided. Schedule: This class will be held on Saturdays, twice a month. Next classes: 9/17 10/1 10/22 Time Schedule ・The 1st Period 12:00-13:15（75 min） + taking souvenir picture *please come by 11:50 ・The 2nd Period 13:30-14:45（75 min） + taking souvenir picture *please come by 13:20 ・The 3rd Period 16:00-17:15（75 min） + taking souvenir picture *please come by 15:50 ・The 4th Period 17:30-18:45（75 min） + taking souvenir picture *please come by 17:20
strTitle: Write your name in Kanji, Hiragana or Katakana

strIntroduction: A perfect time to visit Tokyo is during autumn when the weather is pleasant and leaves begin to change color creating a picturesque scenery across different locations in the city. This tour covers five of the best autumn spots in Tokyo as chosen and recommended by different travel websites and bloggers. A private minivan shall be arranged for your group for convenient access to the sights. The tour itinerary is as follows: - Pick-up from your hotel (additional charges may apply if hotel is not located within central Tokyo) - Visit University of Tokyo Hongo Campus. The campus is one of the most beautiful in Japan and is especially picturesque during autumn when hundreds of Gingko Trees around the campus turn yellow in color. Have a pleasant stroll and see not only the autumn leaves but also the historical structures in the campus - Pass-by Ichounamiki Avenue, a well-known ginkgo tree-lined boulevard which leads to the Olympic Stadium - the main venue of Tokyo Olympics 2020. - Proceed to Yoyogi Park, one of the most famous parks in the city the turns into a forest of red and yellow during late November. - Visit Gyotoku Temple. This off the beaten path destination is unknown to most tourist but is one of the best places in Tokyo to see red and golden maple leaves - Visit Hibiya Park, Japan's first western style park featuring 51 types of trees donated from each of the prefecture across Japan. See their full beauty as the colors change during autumn. At certain times, a chrysanthemum flower display is also held at the park. *** Important Information *** 1) Itinerary may be subject to change depending on local conditions. 2) Condition of the autumn foliage is not guaranteed as weather can affect this. The typical best viewing time is from Late November to Early December. 3) Recommended start time of the tour is 1 pm to be able to see the evening illuminations at Marunouchi area across Hibiya Park 4) This tour is available from November 15 to December 10
strTitle: See 5 of the best autumn spots in Tokyo (Guided Tour)

strIntroduction: Enjoy a full-day of exploring Tokyo - from its traditional temples to its modern architecture. Comfortable coach transportation will enable you to visit many areas of this expansive city, whilst still being ensured that you have plenty of time to walk around and take in each site. Your knowledgeable & licensed tour guide is fluent in English and will be able to answer questions you have about Japan, Tokyo, and its people. The tour guide is also knowledgeable regarding Tokyo's unique architecture and will give you highlights of the history and inspiration behind the designs of many of Tokyo's famous buildings. Your guide will pick you up from the hotel, and your day will begin at the Zojoji Temple, which is one of the most popular Buddhist temples amongst locales. This iconic temple features Japan's traditional style of architecture, and is particularly photogenic because of its juxtaposition with the modern Tokyo Tower behind it. The tour will continue over to the Tokyo Bay, where you will visit the Fuji Sankei Building located on the man-made island "Odaiba" – a must-see area of Tokyo. Next, you will stop by Omotesando & Aoyama, an upscale area popular among younger generations. The area has been likened to the Champs Elysées avenue in Paris, and it features a number of flagship stores and unique buildings, including TOD'S and the Prada Boutique Aoyama, a gorgeous building that demands attention with its unique, stacked-block appearance. You will then relocate to the Ginza area (known for it's high-end shopping and luxury), where you will break for lunch at a stylish restaurant. While traveling through Ginza we will explore buildings such as Shiseido Ginza (Japan's top cosmetic brand) which is famous for its environmental consideration, earthquake-resistant features, and see-through metal exterior, as well as the must-see Maison Hermes building which was inspired by the Japanese lantern. Finally, the tour will relocate to the Tokyo Station area, situated in one of the most important business areas in Tokyo. Here you will explore the impressive International Forum in Marunouchi, which was modeled after a ship! After the tour concludes, you can take you back to your hotel (please make a request during your reservation), although it is recommended that you take your time and explore the Nakadori street after the tour. The area includes interesting destinations like the Mitsubishi Museum, and there are many delicious restaurants to be found in the Marunouchi Building. This area is where many Japanese businessmen and women enjoy their time after work.
strTitle: Tour Tokyo's Modern & Traditional Architecture Highlights

strIntroduction: Your translator guide will pick you up at your hotel and bring you to the training dōjō in Ginza. After you meet the sword-master, you will be instructed in how to put on the traditional kimono worn by samurai. The sword-master will explain and show you various swordplay techniques in the Iai-style of sword drawing, and correct your form as you try it for yourself. This style of swordplay focuses on the fast unsheathing techniques used to draw the sword and immediately disable your opponent. Your teacher is a 7th-level master swordsman in the Hisui-style of Iai, and he has done sword performances at many of the most important shrines in Japan (Ise Shrine, Meiji Shrine, Yasukuni Shrine, etc.) as well as other locations in Japan and throughout the world. You will also get the incredibly rare experience of "tameshigiri" – chopping up grass tatami mats with a real sword! After watching the master swordsman's demonstration you will get to attempt to cut the mat and compare your results. As you will learn in the lesson, when you have too many things on your mind, and when you try to be more than who you are, you will be unable to cut well. A major highlight of the lesson will be on concentration without thinking too much. The full lesson will be translated by your private guide, who will also translate any questions you may have for your instructor. After the lesson is over, you will be free to explore Ginza or travel wherever else you would like to in the city. Note: This activity uses real swords, so it is very important that all participants follow the sword-master's instructions. For safety reasons, some individuals (especially very active or inattentive children) may not be allowed to use the swords and participate in the mat cutting exercise. This decision remains with the sword-master, and we cannot refund any individuals who are not allowed to use the swords. We thank you in advance for your understanding.
strTitle: Private Katana Sword Iai Lesson with a Samurai Descendant

strIntroduction: You will be picked up at your hotel and brought to the restaurant. Once you arrive, your private experience will begin by meeting the master chefs and putting on the chef's apron and hat. The chefs who will guide you through the sushi-making process are all masters of their craft who trained diligently for many years before they were allowed to serve customers. You not only get to learn authentic sushi craftsmanship from a master chef, but you will also get the incredibly rare experience of actually stepping behind the sushi counter to make your creations from the point-of-view of a real chef. The friendly master chefs will guide you through making a number of different traditional "nigiri" sushi using the freshest of raw fish acquired earlier that day from the nearby Tsukiji fish market. Unlike much of the sushi found abroad, this is "real-deal" authentic sushi from a famous restaurant with almost a century of history behind it. You will finish by choosing one hand-roll to make (avocado, tuna or crab), and then you will move to a table to enjoy your creations, miso soup, and a couple of sushi pieces made by the master chef! During the meal the chef and your professional tour guide translator will explain to you the history of sushi, secrets of the trade and answer any questions you may have. In addition to the white chef's coat and hat, each of you will receive a fan, a traditional "yunomi" teacup, and a group photo to remember your experience. Note: This is an authentic experience which uses raw seafood. At the time of booking, you MUST notify the tour operator of any food allergies.
strTitle: Enjoy a Private Sushi Lesson with a Master Chef in Tsukiji

strIntroduction: I carry a fudepen and a postcard all the time, so that I can make Sachifude presents to people. Sachifude is a special type of rule-free calligraphy for writing nice messages. Numazu in Shizuoka is a countryside city in Japan. Most foreign visitors go to Tokyo, but the countryside is also very beautiful and I recommend visiting it too. If you arrive at Numazu or Mishima Station, I will pick up you by my small car (10-20 minute rde). You can enjoy the experience for about 1 hour at my home. You can drink Shizuoka green tea and learn Sachifude's history. Then use the Fudepen and practice Sachifude writing of your favorite Japanese character. Fainally, you can write your own post card. I'll give stamps for a postcard to your country. You can send it to your friends and take the Fudepen with you. This activity is available for 3 to 4 people maximum.
strTitle: Create your original work of Japanese Sachifude calligraphy

strIntroduction: ----- Overview ------- Duration: Approx. 60 mins Req. per Booking: 1-4 guest Req. to Run Class: 1 guest Minimum age is 9 years Minimum height is 130 cm (4.2 ft) --- Class Schedule ---- *10:30 Class starts* The cooking instructor will be waiting for you at the cooking studio. Let’s get started the fun! *Enjoy your meal!* After the class ends, you can enjoy your creation at the cooking studio, or by taking away with the Japanese-style lunch box.
strTitle: Quick-n-Easy! 60 min Inari-Zushi Cooking Class in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Your experience will include stops at 12 family owned stalls and shops which have stood the test of time. At a few of the stops we will sample specialty products like tsukemono (vegetables from the surrounding mountains preserved in vinegar), yuba (the world's smoothest sashimi tofu made from the world famous Kyoto mountain water), and sparkling sake straight from the tap. At the other stops we will buy some specialty items for us to enjoy later at lunch including Saba (Mackerel), Dashimaki Tamago (specialty grilled egg dish made from specialty Kyoto fish and seaweed stock), Sansho (Japanese red pepper), Kamaboko (seafood preserved in fish paste), Tako (Octopus with quail egg) and Matcha (ground tea leaves). During the tour you will learn detailed information about the ingredients of different Japanese dishes, how their food is prepared and what is used to eat it. You will learn the process, from the ground to your bowl, of how white rice is processed for consumption and the origin of roasted tea leaves! Your experience will do more than just give you a chance to taste Kyoto's delicious food but will also give you a sense the history and atmosphere of the Nishiki Market experienced by the Japanese for generations. You will be consumed with physical and visual stimuli every step of the way and will enjoy stories from the past told directly from shopkeepers and families we will spend time with. We look forward to welcoming you to one of most beloved tours in all of Japan and hope to see you soon.
strTitle: Explore Kyoto on a Daytime Walking Food Tour

strIntroduction: Start your tour by walking through the busy streets of Shinjuku heading straight for Omoide Yokocho (literally “Memory Lane”) as our first stop. Omoide Yokocho is rightfully named as it is littered with rustic bars from the 1950s. Anyone of the older generation will feel as if they stepped back in time to the middle of the 20th century. Many of these bars still stay true to their roots, serving roasted giblets with beef and pork, which was a staple when food was scarce after World War II. From there we will make our way to Kabukicho, Asia’s largest, yet safest, red light district stopping at a kushikatsu stall for some authentic regional cuisine called kushikatsu (specialty food from Osaka of deep-fried skewered meat and vegetables). Each of our guests will get 4 kushikatsu and 1 drink. From here we will walk through the rest of Kabukicho, weaving in and out to give our guests a sense of its intoxicating atmosphere until we arrive at our second stop, a local eatery famous for highlighting the authentic regional flavors of southern Japan where guests will get to try 4 different dishes ranging from char grilled chicken, gyoza, chicken namba, miso and vegetables, yakisoba (grilled noodles, vegetables and meat), and cod roe with rice (menus change seasonally). After this, we move into Shinjuku’s Golden Gai neighborhood known for being Tokyo’s most popular spot for unique izakaya, bar stall and pub nightlife. A glimpse back to what Tokyo was like during the early and middle of the 20th century, Golden Gai locations are so densely packed you can almost be in two places at once (one foot in each). Despite is run-down appearance, Golden Gai generally attracts well-off clientele and their prices match accordingly with it being one of the most expensive places to drink in the city. Golden Gai is filled with over 200 small pubs, stalls, and karaoke bars where most are only big enough for five to seven people. Boasting the most densely packed nightlight area in the world, unique in every stall measured in inches rather than feet, Golden Gai will be a glimmer of Tokyo you will never forget and we look forward to having a cold-one with you in this historic place. This tour covers all food costs, 1 drink at kushikatsu and 1 drink at Golden Gai. We require a minimum of 2 travelers for the tour. If you are 1 traveler please contact us.
strTitle: Enjoy a Golden Gai Food Tour in Shinjuku at Night

strIntroduction: You will be able to experience a traditional tea ceremony and writing in Japanese calligraphy. Shodo: Using the “Fude” or brush, you can write your favorite “Kanji” or Japanese characters. After practicing with the basic “Kanji” you can challenge yourself to write more challenging characters! You can take home your writing as a souvenier. Matcha: We will make your “Matcha” or Japanese green tea right in front of your eyes. You will enjoy “Wagashi” or traditional Japanese confections and green tea as part of your Japanese experience. Schedule: ・10:00 start →10:05 shodo→10:35 matcha→11:00 finish ・13:00 start →13:05 shodo→13:35 matcha→14:00 finish ・15:00 start →15:05 shodo→15:35 matcha→16:00 finish Highlights: ・You can sit down on a chair and enjoy “Matcha”. ・You will not only drink Matcha but also make Matcha. ・Children over the age of 12 are required to pay regular price. ・Just 5 minutes away from Tokyo Metro Ginza Station.
strTitle: Discover Japan's traditional tea and calligraphy in Ginza

strIntroduction: Sugamo is an area located north of central Tokyo. It is well-known as Grandma’s Harajuku in comparison to the Harajuku's status as a center of Japanese youth culture and fashion. The Sugamo district retains the old downtown feel of traditional Japan. You can make for an interesting break from Tokyo’s usual pace. In this tour you will visit the district in 3 to 4 hours. I will pick you up at your hotel or we will meet up at Sugamo Station (JR or Mita Subway Line). The tour will start at 10:00 am. First, we will go to the Jizo-dori shooping street. There are almost no big chain stores and instead you will see a lot of unique independent shops, cafes, bakeries and restaurants. The delicacies of the street will surely thrill. A popular traditional sweet is called shio daifuku, which is a sweet azuki bean paste wrapped in soft, slightly salted mochi (sticky rice cake) skin. There are rows of shops selling other variety of sweets and snacks. Totally spoilt for choice. And we will also visit to Koganji Temple halfway down the shopping street. After that, we will go to lunch at Tokiwa-Shokudoh. Various Japanese home style foods are provided at reasonable price (usually less than 1000 JPY per plate). We will wrap up our tour about 02:00 pm at either JR Sugamo Station or JR Otsuka Station (next station from Sugamo). *Options: If you want to take a bath in a hot spring, we can go to the spa facility, Somei-Onsen Sakura. Rates Entrance fee is 1300 JPY (Children aged 3 to 12: 750 JPY). You can pay rental charges for towel and leisure wear worn inside the facilities. If you want to experience a local transportation, we will use the Toei Bus or the Toei Streetcar Arakawa Line around the Sugamo district (200 JPY). Inclusions: Included only guide fee. Drink and food, shopping cost are NOT included. Please pay for host's lunch meal during the tour. If you want pick-up service, host's transportation fee is included. But your transportation fees aren't. If you want to add spa option, please pay for host's entrance fee as well as yours. If you have any questions about my tour, please contact with me anytime!
strTitle: Explore the elderly people's paradise Sugamo, walking tour

strIntroduction: Feel the spirit and history of Edo in Kagurazaka After meeting at Keio Plaza Hotel, Tochomae Station or Shinjuku Station, the tour guide will take participants to Kagurazaka by train. *Please note that seating is not guaranteed. The guide will take participants through the busy shopping areas on Omote-dori street, and past the many refined restaurants tucked away in the alleys, as well as the stone-paved geisha quarter. Kagurazaka has been an area that has flourished for 150 years as a geisha district. While walking down the stone-paved streets with the guide, ponder what the lives of local people might have been like years ago. The tour route includes several famous temples and shrines: Tokyo Daijingu Shrine, Ushigome Mitsuke & Ushigomebashi Bridge, Kagurazaka-dori, Zenkoku-ji Temple. As well as Atamiyu Stairs, Kagurazaka Wakamiyahachiman Shrine, Koguri Yokocho, Kenban, Geisha Shindo etc. Then you will drop by a long-established izakaya bar filled with a Japanese atmosphere and enjoy a glass of refreshing drink and some snacks. When the tour ends in the evening, you are free to explore the district's nightlife or head to your next destination on your own. Time: 14:00 - 17:00 *Available on Sunday, Tuesday, Thursday
strTitle: Explore Street food and Bars in Kagurazaka!

strIntroduction: Experience Japanese Culture with your five senses! First check-in to the venue 10 mins prior to the starting time and enter the shop into a world of Japanese gastronomy! With around thirty seats, the shop incorporates a modern design alongside warmth and lighting achieved through use of articles like antique Japanese furnishings, ancient tree-wood and books. We've created a casual space for customers featuring a sort of Kyoto-esque serenity.. In the daytime, customers can enjoy what we call the Japanese Culinary Experience and Japanese Cafe Experience. In the evening, customers can reserve a table enjoy some Japanese dishes, along with carefully selected Japanese sake(Japanese liqueur). Choose out of 5 options, depending on what you want to learn, cook and eat. ・Sushi Class《11:00 or 16:00 start》 Menu (1 hour 10 mins): 1. Explain about what sushi is 2. Extract dashi(broth) 3. Make sushi vinegar and sushi rice 4. Make miso soup 5. Make sushi 6. Tea 7. ITADAKIMASU (Let’s eat!!) ・Okonomiyaki, Yakitori Class《11:00 or 16:00 start 》 Menu (1 hour 10 mins): 1. Explain what yakitori is 2. Skewer yakitori 3. Roast yakitori 4. Finish yakitori 5. Make okonomiyaki batter 6. Bake okonomiyaki 7. Explain what okonomiyaki is 8. Finish okonomiyaki 9. Tea 10.ITADAKIMASU (Let’s eat!!) ・Japanese cafe class 《Matcha / start time: 10:30- / 14:00- / 16:00-》 *Please input preferred time when you make a reservation. Menu(40 mins): 1. Explain the tea 2. Explain about tools and how to use 3. Make tea 4. Drink tea 5. How to use chasen 6. Japanese dessert 7. Let's eat!! *Participant under 16 must be with a parent and adult price will be charged for all options. *The store is closed on Tuesday.
strTitle: Try cooking Japanese Food in Asakusa!

strIntroduction: Stroll along the streets of Asakusa in a gorgeous Kimono and become part of the scenery! A must-do on your vacation in Japan. Go to Yumenoya Asakusa at your preferred time and choose your favorite Kimono out of a wide selection. Our staff then, will help you dress up. The Kimono is a traditional garment and the word literally means a "thing to wear". Though not casually worn for its complexity in the present day Japan, men and women have adorned them since the historical days. After dressing up, go out onto the streets to walk around the city! There are many Japanese traditional architectures in Asakusa. Enjoy the scenery, peer into a few shops and take lots of pictures as a memoir of your day! Just remember to return the kimono before 5 PM! Available Start Times: 11:00/12:00/13:00/14:00/15:00/16:00 *The store is closed on Fridays.
strTitle: Wear a Kimono and Walk through Asakusa!

strIntroduction: Create your very own Japanese calligraphy souvenir at Kanji House! After a short consultation, our Kanji experts will recommend characters they feel will best fit your personality and express who you are. Then, they will draw them for you beautifully. In Japanese, many characters are pronounced the same, despite having different meanings. This offers the potential for many unique combinations of characters. It’s a great way to take home a piece of Japanese culture and create a special memory of your trip. When you step into Kanji House, you will be welcomed by girls dressed in Kimono and Japanese traditional atmosphere. It’s an experience you’ll never forget!! Options: Choose between 4 plans depending on your preference and availability. Please input preferred time when you make a reservation. The duration for Course 1-4 is 30 minutes, Course 5 is 1 hour and a half. 1. KANJI HOUSE - Basic Plan - (JPY 2800) Tour will start every 30 minutes from 12:00 to 7:30 p.m. Kanji House staff will write your name by appropriate Japanese kanji character after asking your name and your personality. Then your name will be framed and packed by furoshiki which is a Japanese traditional wrapping cloth as a souvenir. 2. KANJI HOUSE - Origami Work Shop Plan - (JPY 3000) This plan starts every 30 minutes from 0:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. In this work shop, you learn how to make origami which is traditional Japanese paper craft. 3. KANJI HOUSE - Small Kakejiku Plan - (JPY 4500) This plan starts at every 30 minutes from 0:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. This plan includes basic plan and a small kakejiku souvenir. A kakejiku, which is also called a kakemono, is a scroll that is mainly hung on the wall of the tokonoma (alcove). Kakejiku are usually paintings that show the beauty of nature. Sometimes they are works of calligraphy that have been done on Japanese paper or silk. In this plan, your name is written on kakejiku. 4. KANJI HOUSE - Large Kakejiku Plan - (JPY 9500) This plan starts at every 30 minutes from 0:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. This plan includes the plan described above as well as a large Kakejiku souvenir. 5. KANJI HOUSE - Guided Tour Plan - (JPY 3800) This plan starts at every an hour and a half from 0:00 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. This plan includes the plan described above and a guided tour of Asakusa. After a fun and informative tour of Asakusa with your knowledgeable guide, you will return to Kanji House to make your Kanji name.
strTitle: Create your own Japanese Calligraphy in Asakusa!

strIntroduction: Visit the two highlights of Tokyo! After meeting at Tsukiji Information Centre, the tour begins with a video called "A day in Tsukiji" featuring Tuna Auctions, active Inner fish market, etc. The Tsukiji Market is the biggest wholesale fish and seafood market in the world and also one of the largest wholesale food markets of any kind. You will walk to the Inner and Outer Tsukiji market and the guide will show you around 690 stalls in the fish section, 120 shops in the fruit and vegetable section, and the Uogashi fish wharf corner. You will also visit 350 stores in the Outer market. Then, you will go to a restaurant and have a traditional Edomae-style sushi lunch. The freshly caught fish will be a meal to remember! After lunch, visit Kabuki-za gallery & enjoy Japanese tea. Kabuki is one of the Japanese traditional performance which involves elaborately designed costumes, dancing, music, and arguably most importantly,the exaggerated actions performed by the actors. Kabuki-za Theatre is a very famous theater for Kabuki in Tokyo. The tour will ends here, so you can carry on shopping on your own, or relax in one of Ginza’s luxury restaurants or trendy coffee shops. *The price will apply to those age 5 and above.
strTitle: Visit Tsukiji Market and Kabuki Gallery in Ginza!

strIntroduction: Experience dressing in a full kimono or samurai set and take a picture in them! While usually renting an actual, full kimono set will cost you big time and money, we’re offering you a cheaper alternative with the full experience in Asakusa Tokyo! You'll get to pick a kimono/samurai outfit of your choice, have a professional dress you up properly, take some photos in your outfits, and take those photos home with you. This experience is provided by the Kenbu Tachibana Ittoryu, which is a sword dance guild and has 80 long years of performance history. strIntroduction: Experience the making of your very own Tenugui hand towel featuring a bright and vivid pattern with traditional Chusen dyeing technique. Tenugui are a patterned, thin cotton cloth traditionally used as hand towels and they are often found in souvenir shops. An English speaking assistant will guide you through the entire process. After meeting at Tenugui Workshop (10 minutes from Keisei Tateishi Station), you will start off learning about tenugui and the chusen dyeing process. Then you will set the pattern sheets onto a wooden screen, and then layer the designs. Be creative and set your very own unique pattern! For the actual dyeing process, you will gently pour the dye over your Tenugui after sketching out the pattern with the paste. To rinse, you will rinse the cloth in water to remove the starch and excess dye, then hang it up to air dry. Cloth Rolling will follow by using a special machine to roll out your tenugui and get rid of any wrinkles and just trim off the edges to complete your hand-made Tenugui! The tour ends at the Tenugui Workshop. Session Schedule: Every Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday operated. Morning session: 10 am - 12 pm Afternoon session: 2 pm - 4 pm
strTitle: Make Your Own Tenugui (Japanese cotton hand towel) in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Visit the famous spots for viewing flowers and enjoying delicious food in the outskirts of Tokyo that can be tricky to visit alone. After meeting at the Keio Plaza Hotel in Shinjyuku, the bus will head towards Hitachinaka, Ibaraki prefecture and make its first stop at Nakaminato for a delicious sushi lunch. Then the adventure will start at Hitachi Seaside Park where the bright red kokias and cosmos flowers are in bloom with a seasonally limited viewing! You will enjoy a superb view with flowers across 3.5 ha of vast land. Then you will visit the Plum Liquor Brewery. Plum liquor ("umeshu" in Japanese) is one of Ibaraki prefecture's specialty products which is widely consumed across the country. The brewery you will visit has been producing plum liquor since the Edo Era. Learn about the history of plum liquor and how it's made, and see the equipment used. You can also try some plum liquor. After plums are pears! Visit a fruit-picking orchard to experience picking pears and eat as much as you like! Chestnuts are specially offered during fruit-picking. After the all-you-can-eat, the bus will head back to Tokyo to drop you off near Shinjuku Station West Exit.
strTitle: Enjoy Autumn Activities at 1-day Hitachinaka Tour, Ibaraki!

strIntroduction: Plunge into the mesmerizing colors of the autumn leaves at Mt. Fuji! This bus tour takes participants to four sightseeing spots for a special price! Following the reception and departure at Osaki Station West Exit Bus Terminal, or Keio Plaza Hotel, the bus will drive to Mt. Kachi Kachi just near Lake Kawaguchi. Here you will take the Mt. Kachi Kachi ropeway for the awe-inspiring scenery of Mt. Fuji and Lake Kawaguchi bordered by colorful autumn leaves. Then, take a walk through a captivating tunnel created by towering maple trees with Mt. Fuji in the background, a spectacular sight you don't want to miss! Near Lake Kawaguchi, you will have a delicious Sukiyaki Set Meal, which is a Japanese dish of simmered in the nabemono (hotpot) style. The filling lunch will be followed by a visit to the Saiko Iyashi no Sato Nenba (Healing Village). This is an old Japanese village which used to be one of the most beautiful thatch roofing houses village in Japan. The Healing Village features beautiful scenery and provides a variety of hands-on-activities, including Japanese paper making and hanging hina doll making. Continuing on, you will enjoy the Fuji Airways Attraction at Fuji-Q Highland, an attraction featuring a virtual flight on the wings of a Fuji Airways airplane. This unique experience flies you from the middle of Tokyo right over the magical slopes of Mt.Fuji-a trip so real, you can almost reach out and touch the sky! The tour ends here, with a ride back to Tokyo, so you can carry on to enjoy a delicious dinner in the center of the city.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Mt. Fuji Autumn Leaf Viewing Tour!

strIntroduction: Delve into the world of pre-historic Japan, with Japan's first tour combining a moving bus theater and a street performance offering an Asakusa experience like never before. This tour has been receiving attention in Tokyo since its first run in 2014, and was featured by multiple overseas media. After meeting at the Asakusa Rokku Central Square, beside the Koen Rokku Koban (small police station), you will get on board the bus which will take you on a tour around Asakusa. The 1-hour tour begins with a seemingly typical bus tour of the famous Asakusa area in Tokyo featuring entertaining commentary presented in a mixture of song and rap by the bilingual DJ (English & Japanese). Everything is going according to schedule when suddenly, two costumed figures who look as if they've slipped through time into present day Asakusa, suddenly appear! Participants can also look forward to taking a photo with the Samurai and Ninja that have just ended the intense acrobatic battle at the end of this action-packed show.
strTitle: Meet a Samurai and a Ninja in the center of Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Explore Tokyo's famous sightseeing spots on a 4.5 hour afternoon bus tour. The tour includes a spectacular view from the Seaside Top and a boat ride on the Sumida River. Following a pick-up at your hotel, or meet at Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal, you will drive to Seaside Top where you will enjoy a 360-degree view encompassing the lively streets of Tokyo and the beauty of Tokyo Bay. The observatory 151 meters high atop the World Trade Center Building. Continue on your way to the Imperial Palace, site of the original Edo Castle. There you will have 10 minutes to take pictures and stroll around. The bus will continue on through Ginza, the upscale shopping district known for its boutique stores, and flagship shops of designer brands, such as Gucci and Christian Dior. Then you will you will visit SensojiTemple in Asakusa, one of Tokyo’s favorite entertainment districts. Founded in 628 AD, the Buddhist Sensoji Temple is Tokyo’s oldest temple and the focus of the city’s largest Shinto festival. You will also have time to browse the shop-lined promenade of Nakamise-dori. Following Asakusa will be a boat ride on the Sumida River, flowing north to south in the heart of Tokyo, from Azumabashi to Hinode Pier. The tour will end by dropping you off at Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal or Tokyo Station, so you can go on to enjoy the delicious food and entertainment Tokyo has to offer.
strTitle: Enjoy Tokyo Afternoon Tour with Sumida River Cruise!

strIntroduction: Experience Tokyo's "Big Three" sightseeing spots including Tokyo Tower, The Imperial Palace and Asakusa through a 4-hour morning bus tour. Following a pick-up at your hotel, or meet at Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal, you will drive to Tokyo Tower, the second-tallest communications and observation tower in Tokyo. There you will get a a spectacular view of Tokyo from the observation deck. Continue on your way to the Imperial Palace, site of the original Edo Castle. You will have a chance to get off and stroll around Sakashitamon-Mae (10 minutes for photo opportunities). Then, continue to Senso-ji Temple in Asakusa, one of Tokyo’s favorite entertainment districts. Founded in 628 AD, the Buddhist Senso-ji Temple is Tokyo’s oldest temple and the focus of the city’s largest Shinto festival. You will also have time to browse the shop-lined promenade of Nakamise-dori. The bus will go on to drive through Ueno and Akihabara to get a glimpse of Japan's famous cultural district, much famous for its anime, manga, and computer goods. Then you will reach Tokyo station Marunouchi South-Exit (drop-off only), and the tour will end at Hamamatsucho Bus terminal. You will have the rest of the afternoon to explore any other parts of Tokyo with easy access from the central station.
strTitle: Enjoy Tokyo Morning Tour at "Big Three" sightseeing spots!

strIntroduction: Book this bullet train package and enjoy visiting Kyoto and have an excellent stay at Kyoto's four-star hotel, Hotel Kintetsu Kyoto Station! Visit Kyoto's beautiful temples and explore the city to learn more about both the ancient and modern culture of Kyoto! Walk around Gion at night to see the beautiful lights of Yasaka Shrine and the Geisha! Hotel Kintetsu Kyoto Station a famous four-star hotel located in downtown Kyoto. Located in a very strategic area, the hotel has many access to various sightseeing spots of Kyoto, making the transportation extremely convenient. The hotel designer combined both the modern and the classic Japanese style for the interior, and the hotel displays many Kyoto-themed artworks. The design and the artworks enhances the atmosphere of the hotel and provides an immersive experience of Kyoto to the visitors. The guestrooms are equipped with sophisticated furniture, fine bedding and linens, and stylish clean bathroom. LAN and WiFi is available in all guest rooms and lobby area. You can visit Kyoto's famous sightseeing spots, which are as follows: - Kinkaku-ji Temple Kinkaku-ji is Kyoto's most famous sightseeing spot and iconic sight. It is famous for its 'Golden Pavilion'. The temple is located in the middle of a pond, ant you can see the clear reflection of the temple on the surface of the pond. - Ginkaku-ji Temple Ginkaku-ji temple has enormous halls and magnificent gardens, which also has a tremendous sand garden in the middle of the temple. Ginkaku-ji is famous for its 'Silver Pavilion'. - Kiyomizu-dera Temple Kiyoizu-dera Temple is one of Kyoto's most famous sightseeing spots, which are always crowded for the whole year. Many people visit Kiyomizu-dera Temple to see the view of Kyoto city from the top of the temple, which is very beautiful. - Gion Gion is Kyoto's most famous Geisha district, and it has many top notch restaurants and izakayas. Indeed, some of the restaurants are awarded Michelin Stars for its quality. The schedule for the tour is as follows: - Day 1 6:00 - 6:55 Transfer to Tokyo station or Shinagawa station on your own. 6:00 - 6:55 Depart to Kyoto station with Nozomi Shinkansen (fastest bullet train). 8:02 - 9:08 Arrive at Kyoto Station - Day 2 Free time - Day 3 Free time until departure 13:10 – 15:50 Transfer to Kyoto Station on your own. 13:10 – 15:50 Depart to Tokyo station or Shinagawa station with Nozomi Shinkansen (fastest bullet train) 15:30 – 18:20 Arrive at Tokyo station or Shinagawa station. ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if we don't get your hotel information soon enough, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office unless you book the optional ""Same Day Delivery Service to Tokyo Hotels"" service (described below). - If you are not staying at a hotel, you are required to pickup the tickets from our office. 2. Optional: Same Day Delivery Service to Tokyo Hotels We offer same day ticket delivery to central Tokyo hotels if the booking is placed before 17:00 JST.
