strIntroduction: Wara village is hidden deep in a mountain valley between Gero and Gujo cities in Gifu prefecture. Here you will not only be able to discover nostalgic images of rural landscape with plenty of rice paddies and corn fields, but you will also see how local people in Japan live their ordinary lives. This will be a unique experience from your trip to Japan! Wara is known for its rivers and freshwater activities. Wara is home to the protected giant salamanders that can be easily seen in the water in August. But more than anything else, Wara is known for the Ayu sweetfish. Plenty of Japanese people come from far away to experience sweetfish fishing and to taste the delicious fish after grilling it on fire with salt. This is exactly the activity that you will try in Wara! Period of the activity: Only between June 15 and August 15 You will be given rental equipment for sweetfish fishing. After fishing, you will be join local people in grilling the fish with salt on fire and eat it! This activity lasts about 3 hours and starts at 10:00 or at 13:00. Note: For an additional 2000 JPY local people can prepare a delicious lunch for you! You can reach Wara village by bus from Gujo city. Alternatively, you can reach it by changing two buses from Hida-Kanayama village as well.
strTitle: Enjoy Ayu sweetfish fishing in the rural village Wara, Gifu

strIntroduction: Wara village in Gifu prefecture is one of the most picturesque hidden rural places in Japan. Located in a valley between the mountains that separate Gujo and Gero cities, Wara has the atmosphere of unspoiled rural beauty that will fascinate the hearts of all visitors. In this village you can not only see nostalgic images of a pastoral landscape, but you can actively interact with the friendly locals and engage in many seasonal activities. Your visit to Wara will be unlike any other experience in Japan and you will have the true opportunity to discover rural life in its most genuine form! Below is the list of seasonal activities you can enjoy in Wara. Please note that you can do only the activity listed under the period of your visit: April 1 - June 9: Cycling around Wara's highlights (which include a brilliant Buddhist Temple with the village's treasure - a legendary demon skull, a spiritual Shinto shrine with unique rock formations, local shops, a small museum of folklore, and more) June 10 - June 25: Firefly watching in the forest June 26 - July 31: Cycling around Wara's highlights (see above) August 1 - August 30: Riverside fun and salamander watching September 1 - September 30: Cycling around Wara's highlights (see above) October 1 - October 31: Harvesting local vegetables and eating them November 1 - March 31: Practicing nose flute playing with local people The starting time is either 10:00 or 13:00, except for the firefly watching which starts from 19:00. Each activity takes about 2 hours to complete. Note: For an additional 2000 JPY per person the local people will prepare a delicious lunch for you! You can reach Wara village by bus from Gujo city. Alternatively, you can reach it by changing two buses from Hida-Kanayama village as well.
strTitle: Try rural activities in the nostalgic Wara village, Gifu

strIntroduction: This activity will transport you to a nostalgic past where people live in a simple way surrounded by beautiful nature and eco-friendly products in one of the most picturesque villages in rural Japan! Welcome to Maze village, hidden in the heart of Gifu prefecture! Spend a day in the pastoral landscape of Maze village and forget about the hassle of the big towns. Enjoy plenty of old-fashioned craft activities and communicate with the hospitable village people! Below is the schedule of the tour: 9:00: Pick up from JR Hida-Hagiwara Station by car 9:30: Start the day by a guided walk around the open-air eco museum town of Maze. See farms, gardens and old houses, and eat fresh tomatoes cooling in river water 12:00: Enter the local charcoal maker's house to interact with local people and eat a delicious lunch prepared by them 13:30: Make a "kokedama" bonsai art or "goheimochi" local sweets together with local people 14:30: You will be sent off to JR Hida-Hagiwara Station where the tour ends Don't miss the opportunity to experience the local lifestyle of Maze village and meet its wonderful and friendly local people! Note: This tour needs to be booked at least 2 weeks in advance. Available only on weekdays between April and November. Public holidays excluded.
strTitle: Enjoy rural activities in the nostalgic village Maze, Gifu

strIntroduction: This activity will transport you to a nostalgic past where people live in a simple way surrounded by beautiful nature and eco-friendly products in one of the most picturesque villages in rural Japan! Welcome to Maze village, hidden in the heart of Gifu prefecture! You will enter Maze from Wara village in the neighbouring Gujo city. Please access Wara yourself from Gujo bus terminal by local bus. You will then spend two wonderful days in Maze before finishing the tour at JR Hida-Hagiwara Station along the JR Takayama line. Below is the schedule of this tour: Day 1 16:00: Pick-up from Wara village by car 17:00: Check in at Miki no Sato hotel 17:00-17:50: Enjoy the hot springs of the hotel facility 18:00: Move to Mizube no Yakata, a wonderful local riverside restaurant and have dinner at the river watching the bonfire 20:00: Return back to Miki no Sato for overnight stay Day 2 9:00: Start the day by a guided walk around the open-air eco museum town of Maze. See farms, gardens and old houses, and eat fresh tomatoes cooling in river water 11:30: Enter the local charcoal maker's house to interact with local people and eat a delicious lunch prepared by them 13:00: Make a "kokedama" bonsai art or "goheimochi" local sweets together with local people 14:30: You will be sent off to JR Hida-Hagiwara Station where the tour ends Don't miss the opportunity to experience the local lifestyle of Maze village and meet its wonderful and friendly local people! Note: This tour needs to be booked at least 2 weeks in advance. Available only on weekdays between April and November. Public holidays excluded.
strTitle: Explore the rural paradise Maze in a 2-day trip from Gujo

strIntroduction: This is a unique activity in which you will see all steps from picking the green tea to serving it at the tea ceremony. Moreover, you will participate in many stages of this process, surrounded by the ambience of the historical heritage of the Former Nagao Residence. This activity takes place in the rural village of Hida-Kanayama, in Gifu prefecture. First, you will visit the Former Nagao Residence and will learn more about its history and the origin of the high-quality "Ikusato" green tea that was delivered from Hida-Kanayama village directly to the court in Kyoto during the Edo period. You will pick green tea yourself from the tea plantation behind the residence using a bamboo basket. Inside the house, you will witness the ancient ways of brewing green tea in a large pot over firewood. You will be fascinated to see that fresh water is pumped up directly from the well. Not only tea, but green tea mochi rice sweets will also be baked in the backyard of the house. You will make your own wooden utensil for cutting the sweets that are served together with green tea. Finally, you will be able to enjoy the green tea with sweets in the tatami room of the historical residence, right under the seal of the Emperor. This is a unique way to experience the traditions of green tea in Japan from the beginning till the end! The activity lasts about 4 hours and begins from 13:30 pm.
strTitle: Pick green tea & brew it by ancient methods, Hida-Kanayama!

strIntroduction: Hida-Kanayama is a small village in Gero prefecture whose central area can be easily explored on foot on the peculiar "Kinkotsu-meguri" tour. You will walk with a knowledgeable guide through a maze of narrow back streets that have always been used as public pathways by the local people. Along the way you will see many unique sights, such as wells and canals of running valley water, some of which are used as public washing places, while others are storing freshwater eel waiting to be delivered to high-class restaurants around Japan. You will also enter several of the village's historical buildings, such as the former bath house and the former silk cocoon factory, where you will discover how people from the past lived in the old days. Among the highlights of this guided walk are the visits to plenty of local food shops, including a tofu factory, a shop for Japanese sweets and a nostalgic tempura restaurant. The tour will end with a visit to a traditional sake brewery that will fascinate you with its collection of antiques and delicious sake for trying! This tour takes about 1 hour and a half to complete on foot. The tour is available until 15:00 pm.
strTitle: Explore the narrow streets & local shops of Hida-Kanayama

strIntroduction: Let this trip be your creative outlet as we feel, learn and practice the Japanese classic art forms of Ukiyo-e and Mokuhan-ga (woodblock printing). First, we’ll meet at Meiji-Jingumae Station (in Harajuku) and take a 15-minute train ride to Fureai-kan. Once there, we’ll introduce ourselves to our artist and host for the day. Our host, an accomplished woodcut tattooist, will share how he got his start in the world of this beautiful craft. Then we’ll learn about Ukiyo-e, a genre of art that became popular during Japan’s Edo period. You’ll get to learn, touch and browse Ukiyo-e prints up close for a deeper look at this craft. Our host will explain in detail the mechanics of Ukiyo-e woodblock printing so that you can produce your own. Even if you’re a complete beginner to this kind of art, the host is more than happy to guide you in recreating beautiful prints for yourself. There will also be a translator so that you can ask any questions and enjoy working directly with the artist. Once the tour is finished, we’ll see an exclusive performance and wood-cutting style to wrap up a truly unique tour through Japanese art! DATES: Every First and Third Tuesday/Thursday SCHEDULE: 2:30 PM Meet at Meiji-Jingumae Station 3:00 PM Arrive at Furei-Kan 3:00 PM-3:20 PM Introductions and overview from the host (including details about the host and their background) 3:20 PM–3:50 PM Overview of Ukiyo-e (viewing and touching the woodblock prints) 4:00 PM-5:30 PM Painting and recreating your own woodblock prints! 5:30 PM Special wood-cutting performance 6:00 PM Departure DURATION: 2:30-6:30 PM, Approximately 4 hours
strTitle: Sensual Immersion in the Art of Japanese Woodblock Printing

strIntroduction: This tour will give you a chance to learn, cook and taste a variety of Japanese foods with a Japanese chef. To start, we’ll head to a greengrocer and scope out a variety of vegetables and produce that normally are not available outside of Japan. If there’s something that catches your eye, this is your chance to pick out an interesting food item and learn the best way to prepare it with the chef. Then, we’ll watch the chef demonstrate a few recipes and imitate his steps. If you’re a beginner to Japanese cuisine, don’t worry. This pro chef has had plenty of practice sharing the tricks that make each recipe easy to follow. At the end, you’ll have mastered a Japanese-style rolled omelet, deep fried tofu and vegetables, onigiri, and an array of other dishes. Plus, they’ll taste even better after knowing you made them yourself! Dates: Available upon request Schedule: 10:30 AM Meet at Meiji-Jingu-mae Station 11:00 AM Arrive at the Ya-ne-sen (from first syllable of the three areas YAnaka, NEzu, and SENdagi) district of Tokyo and visit the nearby greengrocer to select vegetables 11:30 AM Begin the cooking session 11:30 AM-12:00 PM Observe how an expert cook, or Itamae cooks 12:00 PM-12:30 PM Prepare shrimp 12:30 PM-2:00 PM Cook a Japanese rolled omelet 2:15 PM-2:45 PM Cook deep-fried tofu and vegetables 2:45 PM-3:30 PM Make onigiri 3:30 PM-4:00 PM Eat together with a Q&A Duration: 10:30 - 4:30, approximately six hours
strTitle: Become an Apprentice to a Japanese Chef for a Day

strIntroduction: First, we’ll meet at the TABICA office in Harajuku, then leave together for the farm. It takes about one hour. We’ll meet with the farmers, and they will tell stories about their life abroad and how they got their start as farmers. As fellow travelers, we expect there will be lots of interesting episodes and experiences to share. You’ll also enjoy a guided tour around the farm, get a glimpse of nearby temples, and take in beautiful views of the mountain landscape surrounding the farm. The hosts will then take you in for a taste of the "omotenashi" spirit: they will offer tea, Japanese perilla drinks, and a light lunch. To end the day, we’ll take some time learning how to make "takabue", bamboo flutes. This is a traditional handmade craft that Japanese people learn to make as children. We believe that in these few hours away from Tokyo, you'll achieve a sense of calm and relaxation as well as enjoy the music from your new flute. Date: Every Monday, Tuesday, and Friday Schedule: 12:00 - Meet at our office in Harajuku 13:00 - 14:00 Ice-breaking and tour of the farm 14:00 - 14:30 Tea break 14:30 - 15:30 "Takebue" bamboo flute making 15:40 - 16:00 Post-activity open discussion and group picture Duration: 3 hours
strTitle: Make a Bamboo Flute in a Japanese Farm

strIntroduction: We have simple, antique, latest fashion, distinct design and colors. Also, we have a kimono which is like those used in Japanese historical plays. With kimono, it is possible to mix and match a lot of different designs and colors, especially with obi (belt). For example, you can match an antique kimono design with the latest obi (belt) design, and so on. You will certainly enjoy making such coordination. Kimono is a magical dress, unique to Japan. When you wear kimono, you will feel attractive and charming, Japanese “kawaii”, in a special Japanese way. Of course, kimono is beautiful to look at, but it is even more beautiful to wear. We have experienced staff that can provide a basic hair-setting service. You can explore Tokyo in your kimono! In particular, Shibuya has many great places to visit, such as the “scramble” intersection and Hachiko (the famous dog statue), which are very popular for taking pictures. Our staff will take some souvenir photos. We also recommend you to visit Meiji Shirine and Takeshita Street in Harajuku. We can keep our customers luggage, but please take your valuables with you. Rental is normally up to 4 hours - enough time to enjoy exploring Shibuya or Harajuku. The rental time begins after the customer has been completely dressed in kimono and upon leaving our store. Please return to our store approximately four hours after leaving it. The time it takes for our customers to change out of kimono and into their regular clothing is not considered part of the rental time. Choose between the Basic plan (kimono) and the Kawaii plan (long-sleeved furisode). If you are not able to return your kimono within 4 hours of the rental start time, you can rent it till 6:00 pm. In this case please book the add-in Overtime option. If you rent a kimono and keep it till the next day at 6:00 pm. In this case please book the add-on Overnight option. Business Hours 10:00 am to 6:00 pm (Sunday to Thursday) 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm (Saturday) ,Holiday Friday
strTitle: Dress in Kimono & take pictures at the Shibuya crossing

strIntroduction: In this tour, our guide from Tokyo Flour Mania will guide you through bakeries and Japanese traditional spots in the Yanaka/Ueno area, “Shitamachi” (literally “low city”) district of Tokyo where lots of historical Japanese culture is still left. We will visit a bakery (Atom) in the shopping street named "Yanaka Ginza" at first. Then, we will move to Ueno area and split up at Ueno Street. Below is the list of bakeries we will visit. ・Atom The shop name comes from “Mighty Atom” or “Astro Boy” which is a famous manga character that the owner really likes. Astro Boy figures and framed drawings line the shop and customers can buy Astro Boy-themed goods, along with the bread. We will be tasting bread baked in a special oven made from lava from Mt. Fuji. ・Kayaba Bakery They started in 2015 as Kayaba Coffee’s sister shop. One of the unique features of his bakery is its architecture, as it was converted from a kominka, a traditional Japanese house. We will be enjoying bread made from domestic (Japanese) flour and raisin yeast. ・Iacoppé This is a sister’s shop of “BOULANGERIE ianak!” which is located in Nishi-Nippori and specializes in bakery that sells sandwiches made of koppe pan, bread similar to hot dog buns. Koppe pan was once served as part of school lunches in the Showa era, but recently specialized koppe pan bakeries have cropped up as a resurgence and a reinterpretation of this nostalgic bread. They started in 2014. ** We will be sharing one popular bread from each bakery. We will be tasting three kinds of bread in total. Please feel free to purchase any other breads on your own. ** We are planning on walking, but there is the option to take the bus. If the bus option is preferred, please note that bus transportation is not included in the cost of the tour. We might be able to accept special requests, but our regular time slots for the tour are: Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday (10:30 - 12:30/ 13:00-15:00) Please wear comfortable clothes and shoes for walking.
strTitle: Discover hidden bakeries on a Bakery Tour in Yanaka & Ueno!

strIntroduction: Below is the schedule of this mainstream Tokyo tour: 10:00 Meet at your Hotel 11:00 Imperial Palace East Garden 12:30 Lunch at Harajuku / Omotesando 13:30 Meiji Jingu Shrine 14:30 Harajuku Fashion "KAWAII" costume shops 16:00 Asakusa Sensoji Temple 17:00 Tour Ends Tour Duration: 7 Hours Maximum Number of People: 6 Tour Type: Transport Based Tour Highlights: Edo Castle: the residence of the Tokugawa shogun during the Edo period. After the Meiji restoration it became the Tokyo Imperial Palace. Meiji Jingu Shrine: the deified spirits of Emperor Meiji (1852-1912）and Empress Shoken are enshrined. The Meiji era is the period of Japanese modernization started. Harajyuku Takeshita-dori, young fashion district, visit costume shops. Asakusa Senso-ji Temple: Tokyo’s oldest temple located in Shitamachi, old town where I live; we will explore the surrounding streets with a sense of the old local culture which links to Edo period and early Tokyo. There are many good local restaurants and interesting bars; a pleasant place to conclude the tour. The tour does not extend into the evening, but I will be available to make suggestions for where to eat your evening meal or I would join you. Tour Inclusions: Services of a professional Japanese Tour Guide who will meet you at your hotel. Tour Exclusions: Travel costs (buses, subway, JR or taxis.) Admission costs Your lunch is not included.
strTitle: 60% OFF See Tokyo: Imperial Palace, Harajuku, Asakusa

strIntroduction: Take a glimpse of the world of Japanese Otaku culture on this 2.5-hour private tour of Tokyo’s famous Akihabara Electric Town. This intriguing area offers a paradise of stores and cafes catering to fans of video games, comic books, cosplay culture and discount electronics. Meet your guide at your hotel and move to Akihabara by public transport. This iconic area, which was nicknamed Akihabara Electric Town due to its origins as an electronics district after World War II, has evolved in recent years into a cultural hub for lovers of anime, manga, cosplay and video games, who refer to themselves as Otaku, or “nerds.” Begin your walking tour of Akihabara and enjoy an hour at this entertaining and shopping district. Finish your Akihabara excursion at Don Quijote, affectionately known by residents as “Donkey.” This sprawling retail superstore sells everything from luxury goods to everyday groceries. Literally every inch of shelf space is packed with products, offering a fun chance to dig for a bargain. Spend some time browsing this incredible store, then return to public transportation for the trip back to your hotel. Below is the schedule of the tour: -10:00 Meet at a hotel (or a station) -Akihabara: Kotobukiya, Don Quixote and toys, games, figure shops. Learn about Otaku culture from a private guide in this popular shopping district -Lunch time in Akihabara (lunch is not included in the tour, we help you find a restaurant according to your taste) -12:30 Disband
strTitle: Explore the Fantastic World of Otaku on an Akihabara tour!

strIntroduction: In this activity you will wear traditional Japanese wedding costumes, have photos of you taken in a wonderful garden and eat multi-dish Kaiseki meal for lunch in a well-known restaurant in Dazaifu, Fukuoka! Below are the details of the tour: Implementation: Weekdays only Tour type: Private tour Recommended to: Newlyweds and couples Tour schedule: 09:30: Rendezvous → Dazaifu Station → walk to "Shizen-an" restaurant 10:00: Start the make up & hair arrange by a professional staff 11:20: Wear kimono experence 12:00: Walk out to a beautiful garden and have photos taken. On rainy days you can have the photos taken in a Japanese-style room. 13:00: End of kimono experience 13:30: Enjoy a Kaiseki lunch (drinks not included) 14:30: Get photo data DVD from the camera staff & end the activity
strTitle: Wear traditional wedding costume & eat Kaiseki lunch,Dazaifu

strIntroduction: Pick up bicycles and head to Kofukuji Temple. This temple has a number of historic temples and a large pagoda. Ride bicycles to Todaiji Temple all the way weaving through deer meandering through beautiful parks. See the largest bronze statue of Buddha in its great hall. Make your way through the parks and ponds to the ancient Kasuga Taisha Shrine. Walk along the forests paths through 2000 stone lanterns. Bicycle along shady paths to photograph the scenic ponds and Ukimido Gazebo. After finishing the bicycle tour walk around the shopping arcades near Nara Station. There is a large variety of shops and restaurants. This is the end of the tour. I can show you back to the station or recommend a good place to grab a bite.
strTitle: Cycle through Temples, Shrines and Deer in Nara

strIntroduction: Japan is a difficult land for wine making, grapes suffer from hot and humid summers and frigid winters. But determined growers and winemakers have been perfecting their crafts, and local wine in Japan is experiencing a small renaissance. With our wine expert, we offer a day tour in the Katsunuma region, where 80 vineyards in Katsunuma produce 40% of the national production and is the most premier wine region of Japan. The day begins with a tour of one of the most important estate vineyard in Katsunuma and which produces particularly the authentic Japanese grape which raises some attention in the wine world, the “Koshu”. This visit can also be an opportunity to pick up and taste the grapes (only Sept./Oct.). Lunch is a good time around a rather special barbecue: The charcoal grill is made of volcanic rock from neighbor Mount Fuji, which has the reputation for tenderizing meat! The day continues with a visit of the Chateau Mercian, one of Japan’s oldest vineyard, founded in 1877. Their Chardonnais, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot has been shining, winning awards in wine tastings throughout Japan. On site visit to the factory and then the winery to learn all about wine making which ends with wine tasting of course!
strTitle: Go on a Katsunuma Wine Tour, home to Koshu wine

strIntroduction: The flea market opens on the morning of every Sunday in Tokushima city. Over 300 stalls are waiting for you. You can spend a good time just walking the large site filled with many stalls. There are various items of daily use, foods, drinks and more. There are also many antiques, so this flea market is recommended to people who have a keen interest in Japan. Enjoy the flea market in Tokushima!
strTitle: Visit and shop around a big-scale flea market in Tokushima

strIntroduction: First we’ll meet at our office in Harajuku before making our way to the farm by car. It takes about ninety minutes to get to the farm. Once on the farm, we will start picking seasonal blueberries. They are unbelievably juicy and sweet! After making our own smoothies and other creations to cool off under the summer sun, we will enjoy a lunch of Japanese-style chilled wheat noodles. During lunch our host will share with us how he got his start in farming. This farmer takes a deep spiritual approach to his work and teaches us about the god of farming that is believed to dwell in the woods near the blueberry farm. Enjoy this unusual access into the aesthetic and culture behind farming in Japan as well as this farmer's personal approach and story. Dates: Every Thursday Schedule: 1:00 PM Meet at our office in Harajuku and go to the farm together by car 2:30 PM-3:00 PM Pick blueberries 3:00 PM-4:00 PM Make smoothies 4:00 PM-5:30 PM Lunch with explanation of history and culture of the farm Things to bring: Beverage
strTitle: Learn the Ancient Way and Aesthetic of a Japanese Farm

strIntroduction: Most visitors to Tokyo will visit the most well-known sights – Asakusa, Shinjuku, Shibuya, Harajuku and the Meiji Shrine. These are all of course worth visiting, but Tokyo also offer a multitude of choices for travelers looking for a less touristy and typical Japanese experience. The real charm of Tokyo is more discreet. We can discover it in the maze of streets behind the main one, with a village atmosphere, miles away from urban life. It is warm and simple, full of nice shops with clean design as well as charming cafes and small bars. Our local experts can attest, straying off the beaten tourist path is the best way to get a once-in-a-lifetime experience in Tokyo. Most popular spots visited as follows: Imperial Palace / Tokyo Tower/ Asakusa/ Akihabara Electronics Town/ Meiji Shrine/ Shinjuku / Ginza / Aoyama-Shibuya-Harajuku fashion district/ Tsukiji Fish Market and so many other off the beaten track places.
strTitle: Discover Tokyo: The Harmony of Modernity and Tradition

strIntroduction: Join this convenient and comfortable one day bus tour to Yamaguchi prefecture's top sightseeing spots. After pick-up at a centrally-located hotel, the bus will take you all the way to Yamaguchi prefecture to visit Akiyoshidai Safari Land, a wildlife park where animals roam free as if they were in their natural habitat. Visitors can admire them from their own car or getting in one of the feeding bus to hand out food to wild tigers and lions! However, you will also have the chance to get up close with cute and furry animals. It's an exhilarating experience that will bring you closer to the natural world and will become an unforgettable memory. After that, you will take a delicious lunch while enjoying the amazing karst landscape, before moving to the next location: the Akiyoshido Cave. Located 100 meters underneath the Akiyoshidai plateau, the Akiyoshidai Cave is the largest limestone cave in Japan. Scientists believe the cave was formed after millions of years of slow dissolution of a coral reef that existed where the plateau is located today. It is truly a natural wonder. This one day tour of Yamaguchi prefecture's top spots is a perfect way to compliment your trip to Fukuoka, don't miss this chance and book your seats!
strTitle: Enjoy the Akiyoshido Cave and Safari Land Tour from Fukuoka

strIntroduction: The 800 metre long Aharen Beach on the Okinawan island of Tokashiki is a beautifully curved white sand beach with a truly impressive coral reef and crystal clear waters. It offers some of the best snorkeling and diving in the Ryukyu islands, as well as other marine sports. The beach is equipped with lavatories and showers, shops and other stalls where one can rent parasols and other accessories. It is a genuine island paradise for fun and relaxation. This package offers a full day at the beach, a total of 8 hours total excursion time from Naha and back. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: • Meeting time: 09:00 am at Naha Wharf • Departure: 09:30 am from Naha Port by a charter boat. It takes approximately 45 mins for the boat to reach Tokashiki Port, so you should arrive at around 10:15 am. • A shuttle bus will then take you to Aharen beach in about 15 mins. • Arrive in Aharen beach by 10:45 am at the latest, where you will have free time to engage in any activities you choose and have access to the private beach section. • Departure: 16:00 pm - take the shuttle bus back to Tokashiki Port. • Return boat departure: 16:50 pm, arriving at Naha Port at 17:35 pm.
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-day tour at a white sand beach in Okinawa!

strIntroduction: The village of Ogimi in northern Okinawa is renowned for having the highest life expectancy in Japan, a fact that locals attribute to their traditional cultivation of Shekwasa, a citric fruit related to the mandarin. Whether true fact or mere legend, the area is certainly one of the most beautiful locations in Japan with its warm climate and rich soil. The residents of the area promote organic farming methods by giving visitors the opportunity to engage in all aspects of fruit and vegetable planting and harvesting, but this short tour/experience is primarily about fruit picking. For this reason, participants should come prepared with: • comfortable footwear such as sneakers • long sleeves and trousers • gardening gloves You can also join a tour around Ogimi village where, among other things, you will see the traditional Bashoku cloth weaving that has been done in Okinawa for over 500 years.
strTitle: Enjoy Ogimi village fruits picking & village tour, Okinawa!

strIntroduction: What better way to see the amazing Tokyo skyline than from up in the sky? With a Tokyo Sky Cruise, you can do just that. Flying by helicopter from Urayasu Heliport, the course takes you over Tokyo Bay with a wonderful view of Rainbow Bridge, then past Tokyo Tower and the Ginza area with distant views of the famous Shinjuku skyscrapers, Tokyo Dome and the Imperial Palace. The highlight of the course is a complete circuit of the amazing neo-futuristic Tokyo Skytree tower, the world's tallest broadcast tower, the second tallest structure in the world and the highest structure in Japan. Flights begin from 16:00 during summer and 15:30 in winter (until 30 minutes after sunset), and the course flight time is approximately 15 minutes in duration. It is up to you whether you fly while the sun is out, or in the twilight, when the city is beginning to twinkle into life.
strTitle: Enjoy Tokyo Bay and Skytree Helicopter Ride, Urayasu!

strIntroduction: This delightful private tour takes in some of the most picturesque sights that Hokkaido has to offer. Transportation is by a comfortable and convenient car relative to the size of your group, including English guides. Pick up is at Muroran Port at 09:00am, arriving at Lake Toya at 10:00am. This is a volcanic caldera lake and the northernmost lake in Japan that never ices. Marvel at the stunning natural beauty and the crystal clarity of the lake's water. From here, you will take the Mt. Usu ropeway to the observation platforms overlooking Shōwa-shinzan, a volcanic lava dome, and right next to the active volcano Mt. Usu. Here you will have plenty of time to enjoy the impressive scenery of Shikotsu-Toya National Park and have lunch (not included). At 02:00pm the tour will reach Jigokudani (Hell Valley) just above the town of Noboribetsu Onsen. As the main source of the town's famous hot spring waters, the volcanic activity in the valley includes hot steam vents and sulphurous streams; surely one of the most impressive sights in Japan! The tour will drop you off back at Muroran Port at 04:00 pm.
strTitle: Shore Excursion From Muroran to Lake Toya & Noboribetsu!

strIntroduction: For those who don't already know, Odaiba is a man-made island in Tokyo Bay and a veritable wonderland of amusements, hi-tech exhibitions, food and drink and, of course, shopping! One of the few places in the region with direct access to a shoreline, Odaiba boasts impressive views of the bay and beyond, especially at night. It's not surprising, therefore, that it is also home to one of Tokyo's most modern and polished hi-rise hotels, Tokyo Daiba Grand Nikko, just 2 minutes on foot from Daiba Station. Among the hotel's many features and amenities is its ever-popular seasonal outdoor terraced pool. One of the most luxurious pools in Tokyo, it offers some amazing views of the ocean, Rainbow Bridge, and the Tokyo skyline. Choose between daytime (weekend or weekday) or twilight time pool experience!
strTitle: Enjoy Tokyo Daiba Grand Nikko Pool Experience, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This one day tour of Saga prefecture will allow you to visit the most notable sightseeing spots in the nearby Saga prefecture, departing from Fukuoka. The tour will start at the Kyushu Ceramic Museum, where you will be able to admire pieces of ceramic art from Kyushu, especially from the Heizan area. Next, the tour will take you to Arita Toji no Sato Plaza , the largest place to purchase goods made out of this kind of porcelain raging from daily-life articles and even some good-priced masterpieces. For lunch, you will try delicious Kyushu specialties in a Japanese style set meal before continuing with the tour and stopping at Yutoku Inari Shrine, one of the three major shrines dedicated to Inari, the Goddess of rice and prosperity. Besides it's beautiful appearance, the shrine is visited by both locals and visitors alike to pray for good fortune, especially in business. The last stop in the tour will be the Sake Brewery in Kashima, whose sake won the Grand Prix "Champion Sake" at the International Wine Challenge, the most prestigious wine competition in the world. Perhaps the secret to their exquisite sake is the fact that they use water from the sacred mountain of Tara-dake and rice from the Saga Plains. The tour will have several drop-off options, from which the most recommended is the Ureshino Onsen. What better way to end a day of sightseeing and wine tasting, than by soaking in the sodium-rich waters of this hot spring district. You might even decide to stay the night and treat yourself to endless relaxation.
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-Day Saga sightseeing & shopping tour from Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Enjoy the convenience and comfort of visiting one of Japan's most emblematic and important shrines as well as other memorable sites without any hassles in this one day bus tour. The tour will start at Miyajidake Shrine home of the famous "three number ones", which refer to Japan's largest sacred straw weighting more than 3 tons, the largest shrine bell and the largest traditional drum. The shrine is visited by over 2 million people each year who pray for good luck especially in business. The shrine is the site for a monthly ritual named Tsuitachi Mairi, in which the shrine grounds are packed with souvenir and snack vendors. Miyajidake Shrine is also notable for their wide variety of flowers that bloom depending on the season of the year. From July to August, for instance, you can see the colorful blossoms of hydrangeas and other flowers. Next, you will head to the town of Okagaki, where you will visit a restaurant to indulge in a bbq-style lunch featuring delicious beef and pork dishes. You will finish the tour with a visit to Munakata roadside station, the most popular one in Japan, offering local and fresh agricultural and marine products, especially the delicious fish caught in the Genkai-nada Sea. Don't miss the chance to visit one of Japan's most emblematic shrines and enjoy the area's local products with this one day tour.
strTitle: Enjoy Miyajidake Shrine Flower Viewing & BBQ Lunch, Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Enjoy Fukuoka's highlights and a world-class shopping with this one day bus tour that takes you to unmissable spots in the city. Start of by learning the history of the city and admiring precious items on display at the Fukuoka City Museum. The exhibit features rare and valuable historic objects such as a golden stamp from a Chinese emperor given to a Japanese envoy as well as the popular spear from the song of Kuroda. After the visit, the tour will visit Fukuoka Tower, Japan's largest seaside tower featuring over 8,000 mirrors and reaching a height of 234 meters. The observatory located 123 meters above the ground offers visitors 360 degree, panoramic views of Fukuoka. You will then head to the Hilton Fukuoka Sea Hawk hotel to indulge in a delicious buffet style lunch included in the package tour. After a hearty meal, you will be ready to explore the endless stores available at Marinoa City outlet shopping mall. There, you will also receive a free ticket to ride the Skywheel Ferris wheel and a discount coupon valid in several stores in the mall. Compliment your sightseeing of Fukuoka with amazing shopping opportunities with this convenient one day tour.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-day Fukuoka's sightseeing & Marinoa City mall tour

strIntroduction: Visit the internationally famous Cat island and other amazing sites with this convenient one day bus tour departing from Fukuoka. The tour will take a bus and then a ferry to visit Ainoshima island, also known as the cat island, a historic island mentioned in ancient poetry literature such as the Man’yoshu, and home to hundreds of stray cats that roam freely the island and that have attracted a high numbers of cat lovers interested in playing around with them and taking pictures. You can enjoy the company of the cats while you eat a Japanese bento box included in the tour. After the visit and the ferry back to the mainland the tour will head to Munakata roadside station, the most popular in Fukuoka. Here, you'll have the chance to shop for fresh, locally produced agricultural and marine products. The speciality to look out for is the delicious fish caught at the Genkai-nada Sea. After stocking up on local goodies, you will head to Munakata Shrine, a religious site devoted for praying for those who will travel by road or sea and it's considered one of the oldest temples in Japan of it's kind. The shrine is also the site of the Miare festival, in which dozens of boats carry a portable shrine by sea. This tour is perfect for visiting these unique sites without hassle and enjoy a full day of memorable sightseeing around the beautiful Fukuoka prefecture.
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-Day tour to Cat Island & Munakata Shrine, Fukuoka

strIntroduction: This is a half-day tour of Fukuoka city including some of the most popular spots in the city for foreign visitors and locals alike. After boarding the bus at a centrally-located hotel, you will visit Ohori Park. Ohori park is a beloved public area where locals gather to admire the beautiful landscape incorporating water elements, which makes it unique among Japanese parks. Then, you will head to Ohori Park Japanese Garden, constructed to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the inauguration of Ohori park and features a traditional landscaping techniques as well as modern elements that together crate a large scale, circuit-style garden with a variety of hills and ponds. The tour will board the bus again and in our way, we will drive by the Fukuoka castle, which construction began in 1601 for the daimyo Kuroda Nagamasa. Today it features assets designated as important cultural property. Finally, your guide will ask you your preference to decide the last stop on the tour. Either the Fukuoka Municipal Zoo or the Fukuoka Municipal Botanical Gardens. The Municipal Zoo features 130 species of animals roaming about in an idyllic natural environment. Some of the most popular animals on display are rare gorillas, elephants, giraffes and the Arabian oryx. The Fukuoka Municipal Botanic Gardens offer the visitor a great variety of facilities to enjoy the more than 2,600 varieties of plants in 10 hectares featuring a greenhouse, an observatory, large flower beds, etc. Get to know Fukuoka's municipal attractions that delight both foreigner and locals alike, and provide a perfect way to get a closer look to the local pulse of the city.
strTitle: Enjoy a half day tour Ohori Garden & Municipal Zoo, Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Explore popular sites in Saga and Nagasaki prefecture with this one day tour departing from Fukuoka. Start of your day with a magnificent one hour cruise around Kujukushima, literally meaning 99 islands, it's a natural area featuring over 200 beautiful islands on board the elegant "Queen Pearl" boat. Then, head to Arita Porcelain Park, a small theme park built to resemble the Zwinger Palace in Germany that houses porcelain ware from Arita and from many countries around the world. At this location, you will also indulge in a delicious buffet style lunch featuring local and fresh ingredients from Saga and Nagasaki. Lastly, you will be taken to Munemasa Shuzo Arita Kura, a sake brewery where you will learn about the manufacture and bottling process of the most popular and representative beverages of Japan; shochu and sake. Don't miss the chance to experience these unique sites in Nagasaki prefecture with the comfort of an all-inclusive 1-day bus tour.
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-day Kujukushima cruise and ceramics town tour

strIntroduction: Enjoy an afternoon filled with fun activities with this half a day tour that takes you to some of the best spots for sightseeing in Fukuoka. Get on the bus at 13:00 or 13:20 and head to the Fukuoka Tower, Japan's tallest seaside tower standing at 234 meters and covered in more than 8,000 mirrors. go up all the way to the observatory deck located 123 meters above the ground and enjoy 360 degree panoramic views of the city below. Next, enjoy the city from the water. Get on a cruise to explore Hakata Bay and feel the marine breeze as you admire the landscape. The cruise will drop you off within walking distance of our next destination: Marine World Uminonakamichi, an aquarium that is home to more than 30,000 organisms of 450 kinds and mainly features marine life from the warm currents of Tsushima. The exhibit can be experienced through audio, video and underwater camera displays. Take advantage of this tour packed with fun activities and make the most out of your visit to Fukuoka.
strTitle: Explore some of the best sites of Fukuoka in half a day tour

strIntroduction: The National Diet Building is the center of Japan’s politics as it is the place where Diet sessions are held. The building is in Nagata-cho, Chiyoda ward, Tokyo, and features a pyramid-like tower in its center. It was completed in 1936, after 17 years of work involving a total of 2.54 million people at a cost of 25,736,000 JPY. The central tower was the tallest building in Japan when it was completed. Entering the inside of the building is a special experience even for Japanese people. Consider this tour as one of your options during your stay in Japan. In the National Diet Building, you can see the lobby, conference hall, central hall with its gorgeous decorations and a rest lounge used by the Emperor. After exploring the National Diet Building, move to Kensei Kinenkan (memorial hall of the constitution process) located behind the Diet Building, and learn the history of Japan’s politics. And then walk to Akasaka Excel Hotel Tokyu, and enjoy the buffet-style lunch, including popular crab and roast beef! Schedule of the tour: 10:40: Meet at exit 1 of Kokkaigijido-mae subway station Visit the National Diet Building Visit the Kensei Kinenkan (free time to explore in about 20 minutes) 13:30: Move to Akasaka Excel Hotel Tokyu for lunch (about 90 minutes), end the tour at a convenient time (until 15:00) * The participants must be 4 years or older. However, infants 3 years or younger can join the tour for free (1 infant per adult). Be sure to let us know beforehand in this case About The National Diet of Japan voyag.in/2cDD4Ff Check the Tour Conditions link below. voyag.in/2c7AgMg
strTitle: Enjoy National Diet Tour and Buffet Lunch, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Kagurazaka is a fashionable shopping and dining district along a sloping street in Tokyo. During the Edo Period, Kagurazaka was located just outside the outer moat of Edo Castle and gained prominence as an entertainment district with numerous geisha houses and restaurants. Some of the geisha houses survive in the district's narrow alleys to this date. While a geisha is female, a male geisha is called “taikomochi.” Currently, there are only 5 taikomochi in Japan. Why not enjoy taikomochi show in this historical place! Enjoy the genuine traditional Japanese cuisine and the Ozashiki (the party in a tatami room with a geisha) at the distinguished old restaurant, Kagurazaka Shimakin, which was established in 1869. We offer a special and reasonable taikomochi and unagi (eel) lunch course for you. This plan includes the guide, so it is one of the easiest and most affordable to see taikomochi performing in Tokyo. The following is the schedule: 12:00 Lunch 12:30 Performance 1 13:15 Break 13:30 Performance 2 14:00 Event end * If you are not a fan of unagi (eel), please let us know beforehand. It can be changed to tempura. * Note that you can take photos, but not videos. * Participants must be 6 years or older. Check the Tour Conditions link below. voyag.in/2c7AgMg
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Taikomochi Show and Cuisine, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Take a cruise along five rivers in Tokyo! The cruise includes the Nihonbashi River, Kamejima River, Sumida River, Onagi River, and Ohyoko River. Guests can go on the exciting Koumon (Lock) ship elevator, and see an amazing view of Tokyo Skytree. Cruisers get a totally unique experience that you can't get on land. Nihonbashi is linked by the Nihonbashi River to some of Tokyo's major waterways, including the Sumida River, each with its own character and each offering a variety of excursions. They offer a view not only of the city's many famous bridges but of the dramatically changing face of the city. The river cruise is popular, and in some seasons sell out almost immediately. We offer a special plan for you. The following are three timetables (Select one): <9:40 Course> 09:40 Meeting up/Reception in front of Nihonbashi Uogashi Kinen Hi (Nihonbashi Uogashi Monument) 09:50 Boarding at Nihonbashi Pier 5 River Cruise 11:20 Disperse at Nihonbashi Pier <11:30 Course> 11:30 Meeting up/Reception in front of Nihonbashi Uogashi Kinen Hi (Nihonbashi Uogashi Monument) 11:40 Boarding at Nihonbashi Pier 5 River Cruise 13:10 Disperse at Nihonbashi Pier Check the Tour Conditions link below. voyag.in/2c7AgMg
strTitle: Enjoy Private Cruise over Five Rivers in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: The Nihonbashi-Kanda River Cruise provides a glimpse of the contrast between premodern Edo and present-day Tokyo. The Nihonbashi Pier was completed in 2011, featuring ornamental caps replicating the original wooden bridge. Depart from this pier for a fun cruise and a history lesson on the Edo Period in Tokyo. Guests can get a unique view of the largest bridge on the Nihonbashi River, the Edobashi Bridge and pass underneath it. Depending on the tide you can almost touch the underside of the bridge! This area also connects some of Tokyo's major waterways, each with its own character and a variety of excursions. They offer a view not only of the city's famous bridges but the dramatically changing face of the city. The cruise is extremely popular and tickets sell out almost immediately. We offer a special plan for you. The following plan has two two different schedules (Select one): <9:40 Course> 09:40 Meeting up/Reception in front of Nihonbashi Yuraiki no Hi (Nihonbashi History Monument) 09:50 Boarding at Nihonbashi Pier Nihonbashi River & Kanda River Cruise 11:20 Disperse at Nihonbashi Pier <11:30 Course> 11:30 Meeting up/Reception in front of Nihonbashi Yuraiki no Hi (Nihonbashi History Monument) 11:40 Boarding at Nihonbashi Pier Nihonbashi River & Kanda River Cruise 13:10 Disperse at Nihonbashi Pier Check the Tour Conditions link below. voyag.in/2c7AgMg
strTitle: Enjoy Nihonbashi River and Kanda River Cruise in Tokyo!
